0.title: Last few seats remaining in Manipal University for online degrees
0.article_body: Manipal University Jaipur announced that seats are filling up fast for UGC-entitled online degrees like MBA, BCom, BBA, BCA, and MCA. Students can get a degree from NAAC A+ accredited university while working, and benefit from attractive scholarships, placement assistance, free access to Coursera, and ₹50,000 worth of free e-learning courses, the University stated. Enrol today to block your seats.

1.title: 2 floors of building collapse in Delhi after blast due to LPG leak
1.article_body: The walls of the second and third floors of a building collapsed after a blast due to an LPG leak in Delhi's Chhattarpur area on Thursday, officials said. In the incident, one person was critically injured. The locals said that the smell of gas was coming from the said building for the last couple of days, police said.

2.title: Mumbai civic body to keep digital record of students' health
2.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) will keep a digital health record of children studying in Mumbai Public Schools (MPS). Reports of all periodical health check-ups, specific medical condition of a child and ongoing medicines will be collated by the BMC education department. "If any child is seen developing any health issue...proactive action can be taken," an official said.

3.title: 2 terrorists who shot dead 35-year-old TV artiste Amreen killed in Kashmir
3.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir police has said that two Lashkar-e-Taiba terrorists, who shot dead Kashmiri TV artiste Amreen Bhat, have been neutralised in Kashmir's Awantipora. "Heinous murder case of TV artiste Amreen Bhat solved in 24 hours...10 terrorists including three from Jaish-e-Mohammed and seven from Lashkar-e-Taiba terror outfits killed in 3 days in Kashmir Valley," IGP Kashmir Vijay Kumar said.

4.title: I'm a fan of Jack, wish he stayed on the board: Musk after Dorsey exits Twitter board
4.article_body: After former Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey stepped down from the company's board, Tesla CEO Elon Musk tweeted, "I'm a fan of Jack." Musk added, "Wish he would stay on the board, but I understand that he needs to move on." Dorsey had quit as Twitter CEO in November last year after handing over the post to Indian-origin Parag Agrawal.

5.title: Geetanjali Shree's 'Tomb of Sand' becomes 1st Hindi novel to win Booker Prize
5.article_body: Author Geetanjali Shree's translated Hindi novel, 'Tomb of Sand', has become the first book written in an Indian language to be awarded the International Booker Prize. Originally published in Hindi as 'Ret Samadhi', the book was translated into English by Daisy Rockwell. "I never dreamt of the Booker, I never thought I could. What a huge recognition," Geetanjali Shree said.

6.title: US govt agency asks Tesla for info on Tesla car fire in Canada
6.article_body: The US NHTSA has asked Tesla for information on a recent fire incident involving a Tesla model in Vancouver, Canada. The Tesla owner had claimed that his car shut down after an error notification, following which it started filling up with toxic smoke. He had to break the car window to escape as the door did not open.

7.title: Husband of teacher killed in US school shooting dies while preparing for her funeral
7.article_body: The husband of a fourth grade teacher killed in the mass shooting at an elementary school in US' Texas has died from a heart attack, family members told the New York Times. Joe Garcia was preparing for the funeral of Irma Garcia, his wife of 24 years, when he collapsed and died. The two reportedly leave behind four children.

8.title: Afghan man with medicines worth ₹64 lakh detained at Delhi airport
8.article_body: An Afghan national was detained by Central Industrial Security Force at the Indira Gandhi International Airport for carrying tablets worth ₹64.40 lakh in an alleged unauthorised manner. "The passenger couldn't produce supporting documents or a medical prescription for carrying such a huge quantity of medicine," a CISF officer said. The medicines are understood to be used for treating brain tumour.

9.title: MCD issues helpline to counter misconception about demolition drives
9.article_body: Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) on Thursday issued a helpline number (8588813545) to help counter "misconception" about its demolition drives. A public notice issued in this regard said a "misleading campaign" has been launched recently stating MCD will demolish buildings and shops in unauthorised colonies. "It's hereby clarified that MCD has no such plans," the notice said.

10.title: India not planning to curb rice exports, has sufficient stocks: Report
10.article_body: India, the world's top rice exporter, is reportedly not planning to curb exports of rice as it has sufficient stocks and local rates are lower than state-set support prices. "There's no concern at all in terms of either prices...or availability for exports and domestic requirements," a government official told Reuters. This comes after India banned wheat exports on May 14.

11.title: India will get criticised for choosing self-reliance, so be it: Adani
11.article_body: India's richest person Gautam Adani, in a post he shared on LinkedIn, said India is right to focus on self-reliance and must go through the process even if there is pushback. "Many will try to stop us from building semiconductor plants...from investing a larger portion of our GDP in defence...So be it," he wrote, while calling global cooperation a "facade".

12.title: CBI arrests businessman Avinash Bhosale in Yes Bank-DHFL case
12.article_body: The CBI on Thursday arrested Pune-based real estate group ABIL's Chairman Avinash Bhosale in the Yes Bank-Dewan Housing Finance Corporation (DHFL) fraud case. The arrest comes nearly a month after CBI conducted raids on the premises of Bhosale and two other builders Vinod Goenka and Shahid Balwa. As per CBI, illicit funds were allegedly routed through several real estate companies.

13.title: Car tech firm ECARX to go public in China's largest US listing since DiDi
13.article_body: Chinese auto tech startup ECARX, backed by billionaire Li Shufu, on Thursday said it will go public through a merger with blank-check company COVA Acquisition Corp in a deal that values it at $3.82 billion. As per Bloomberg, this will be the largest Chinese listing in the US since DiDi Global Inc. ECARX develops software and hardware systems for cars.

14.title: ABB acquires 72% stake in Bengaluru-based EV startup Numocity
14.article_body: Swiss technology company ABB on Thursday announced that its e-mobility division has agreed to acquire a controlling stake in Bengaluru-based electric vehicle (EV) charging solutions startup Numocity. With this, ABB's shareholding in Numocity will increase to 72% from 7% earlier, and it will gain the right to become its sole owner by 2026. The acquisition cost wasn't disclosed.

15.title: Velocity to face Supernovas in Women's T20 Challenge final despite loss vs Trailblazers
15.article_body: Smriti Mandhana-led Trailblazers defeated Deepti Sharma-led Velocity by 16 runs in the last league stage match of Women's T20 Challenge. Despite the win, Trailblazers failed to qualify for the final. Supernovas finished on top of the points table, while Velocity finished second having a better net run-rate than Trailblazers. Supernovas will face Velocity in the final on Saturday.

16.title: Centre to hold meeting with Flipkart, Amazon over fake reviews
16.article_body: The Consumer Affairs Ministry will hold a virtual meeting on Friday with stakeholders, including e-commerce entities like Flipkart, Amazon and Reliance Retail, to discuss the magnitude of fake reviews on their platforms. The ministry said fake and misleading reviews violate a consumer's right to information. The meeting will discuss possible measures to prevent such anomalies, it added.

17.title: I've asked ministers not to use red beacons atop their cars: WB CM
17.article_body: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee said that she has asked the state Cabinet ministers not to use red beacons atop their cars while travelling. Speaking during a felicitation ceremony of Kolkata Police, Banerjee said, "Even the police use red beacons for smooth movement." She added, "All of this is not appreciated by people, they don't like this."

18.title: India will help Sri Lanka in economic recovery: PM Modi in Chennai
18.article_body: Speaking during his Chennai visit, PM Narendra Modi assured that India will support Sri Lanka's democracy, stability and economic recovery. "India is providing all possible support to Sri Lanka. This includes financial support, fuel, food, medicine and other essential items," he said. He noted that many Indian organisations and individuals have sent assistance to the people of Sri Lanka.

19.title: Pakistan govt raises petrol price by PKR 30 per litre, new rate effective from midnight
19.article_body: Pakistan government on Thursday announced it has decided to raise prices of petrol by PKR 30 per litre, with the hike set to go into effect at midnight tonight, Dawn reported. The announcement was made at a press conference in Islamabad. This comes a day after the government and the IMF failed to reach an agreement on an economic bailout.

20.title: 2020 saw over 18% lesser road accidents, 12% lesser deaths: Report
20.article_body: A report released by the Ministry of Road Transport and Highways (MoRTH) stated that the number of road accidents saw nearly 18.46% decline in 2020, as compared to 2019. It further stated that the number of people who died in road accidents also saw a decline by 12.84%. Over 3.66 lakh road accidents were reported in 2020, the report stated.

21.title: Dr Ambedkar's statue vandalised in Uttar Pradesh's Mahoba
21.article_body: Police said that a statue of Dr Bhimrao Ambedkar was allegedly vandalised by unidentified people in Panwari town of Uttar Pradesh's Mahoba. "Unidentified miscreants damaged the statue installed at the Mela Ground on Wednesday night," Circle Officer Umesh Chandra said. BSP members, led by district president Gangadeen, staged a protest against the incident and demanded the restoration of the statue.

22.title: Actor Kevin Spacey charged with sexual assault against three men
22.article_body: Kevin Spacey has been charged in the UK with four counts of sexual assault against three men. Spacey "has also been charged with causing a person to engage in penetrative sexual activity without consent". While charges were authorised on Thursday, Spacey isn't currently in England or Wales and charges can't formally be applied until he enters one of those countries.

23.title: Congress workers protest against vandalism of Nehru statue in MP
23.article_body: Congress workers staged a protest after some miscreants allegedly damaged the statue of former PM Jawaharlal Nehru in Madhya Pradesh's Satna. "The incident took place on Tuesday, some BJP workers vandalised the statue of Jawaharlal Nehru. We demand the immediate arrest of the accused (by) the administration," a Congress worker said. The police have taken six people into custody.

24.title: Assam CM spews hate to make RSS happy: AIUDF MLA on madrasa remark
24.article_body: All India United Democratic Front (AIUDF) MLA Rafiqul Islam criticised Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma over his madrasa remark and said that the latter "spews hate to make RSS happy". "He must know students from madrasas are becoming doctors and engineers," Rafiqul Islam said. Earlier, the Assam CM said madrasas should cease to exist.

25.title: BJP using CBI to scare opposition: Congress leader after CBI raids
25.article_body: After the CBI conducted raids at Ranchi residences of former state minister and Congress leader Bandhu Tirkey, he criticised the BJP and accused the party of using CBI. "Whenever there are polls in state, this happens...If we oppose wrongful BJP policies, they scare non-BJP members using CBI," Tirkey said. Tirkey was raided in connection with 34th National Games scam.

26.title: No intention of building military base in Solomon Islands: China
26.article_body: Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi has said that China, which signed a security pact with Solomon Islands last month, has no intention of building military base there. "[The security pact] isn't imposed on anyone, nor...targeted at any third party," Yi said. US, Australia and New Zealand had voiced concerns over possible Chinese military presence in Solomon Islands due to pact.

27.title: Lithuanian parliament accepts draft bill on same-sex unions
27.article_body: Lithuanian parliament on Thursday voted to accept a draft bill on legalising same-sex unions, enlisting it for further debate. As many as 70 lawmakers voted in favour of draft bill, which "regulates...principles of monogamy, voluntariness, equality [and] legitimate expectations," a lawmaker said. The bill will now move to parliament committees before returning for a second plenary vote in June.

28.title: IAS couple who used Delhi stadium to walk their dog transferred to Ladakh, Arunachal
28.article_body: IAS officer couple Sanjeev Khirwar and Rinku Dugga have been transferred to Ladakh and Arunachal Pradesh, respectively, after being accused of using Delhi government-run Thyagraj Stadium for walking their dog. Athletes and coaches had complained about being forced to wrap training by 7 pm and empty the stadium so that Delhi's Principal Secretary (Revenue) Khirwar could walk his pet.

29.title: PM to inaugurate India's biggest drone festival in Delhi tomorrow
29.article_body: PM Narendra Modi will inaugurate India's biggest drone festival, the Bharat Drone Mahotsav 2022, at Pragati Maidan in Delhi on Friday. He said this forum brings together key stakeholders including startups with the aim of increasing India's presence in the sector. "I'd urge all those interested in tech and innovation to watch the programme," PM Modi added.

30.title: Earthquake of magnitude 7.2 hits Peru, no casualties reported
30.article_body: An earthquake of magnitude 7.2 hit the Tirapata region of southern Peru on Thursday, the US Geological Survey (USGS) said. Meanwhile, the US Tsunami Warning System said there was no tsunami warning in place, adding that there were no early reports of damage or casualties. Reportedly, the earthquake was also felt in the southern regions of Arequipa, Cusco and Tacna.

31.title: IAS couple who used Delhi stadium to walk their dog transferred to different states
31.article_body: IAS officer couple Sanjeev Khirwar and Rinku Dugga have been transferred to Ladakh and Arunachal Pradesh, respectively, after being accused of using Delhi government-run Thyagraj Stadium for walking their dog. Athletes and coaches had complained about being forced to wrap training by 7 pm and empty the stadium so that Delhi's Principal Secretary (Revenue) Khirwar could walk his pet.

32.title: Don't touch me, you're untouchable: Religious preacher to man touching his feet on video
32.article_body: A video showing religious preacher Dhirendra Krishna Shastri calling a man "untouchable" is being widely shared on social media. The video shows the man trying to touch the preacher's feet on stage, following which Dhirendra Krishna Shastri says, "Don't touch me. You are untouchable." Several organisations, including Tribal Army and The Dalit Voice, have called for his arrest.

33.title: Johnny Depp's alleged text message about Amber Heard & Elon Musk's affair surfaces
33.article_body: In a text allegedly sent in 2016, Johnny Depp said Amber Heard was "begging for global humiliation" and "she's gonna get it". Depp talked about the alleged affair between Heard and Elon Musk and called Heard a "gold digging, low level...dangling overused flappy fish market." "Come see me face to face...I'll show him things he's never seen before," it read.

34.title: Pakistan's National Assembly approves bill to stop use of EVMs
34.article_body: Pakistan's National Assembly on Thursday approved a bill that seeks to stop the use of electronic voting machines (EVMs) in general elections as well as disallow overseas citizens from voting in polls. The Elections (Amendment) Bill 2022 is expected to be sent to Senate on Friday, local media reported. Notably, these reforms were brought in by ex-PM Imran Khan's government.

35.title: We feel for you: Prince Charles as he meets Ukrainian refugees
35.article_body: Britain's Prince Charles on Wednesday travelled to Romania's capital Bucharest to meet the Ukrainian refugees who fled their country since Russia began its invasion in February. Speaking to a group of Ukrainians through an interpreter, Charles said, "We feel for you greatly, it's a nightmare situation. I'm full of admiration for the Ukrainian people. Total, extraordinary courage and resilience."

36.title: Authorities in US' California on high alert after Texas school attack
36.article_body: Authorities in US' Southern California are on high alert after 21 people, including 19 students, were killed in a school shooting in Texas earlier this week. Police departments of some cities in Los Angeles County, including Arcadia, have said they will increase patrols around local schools to ensure the safety of children. The suspected attacker was shot dead by police.

37.title: Govt committed to popularise Tamil language, culture: PM in Chennai
37.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday said the Government of India is fully committed to further popularising the Tamil language and culture. "In January this year, the new campus of the Central Institute of Classical Tamil was inaugurated in Chennai," he added. Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin urged PM Modi to make Tamil an official language like Hindi.

38.title: Spain reports 25 new cases of monkeypox, country's tally rises to 84
38.article_body: Spanish Health Ministry reported 25 new cases of monkeypox on Thursday, taking the total number of infections in the country to 84. The Health Ministry also added that there are 73 suspected cases of monkeypox in the country. Meanwhile, Spain's neighbour Portugal reported nine new cases of the viral disease on Thursday, bringing the total number of infections to 58.

39.title: 7-year-old captured leopard burnt alive in Uttarakhand; FIR filed against 150 people
39.article_body: A seven-year-old male leopard captured by the Uttarakhand forest department was burnt alive by a mob in a village in Uttarakhand's Pauri Garhwal district on Tuesday. Officials said that the locals were angry over the death of a woman, who was mauled by a leopard earlier this month. An FIR has been registered against the village's pradhan and 149 others.

40.title: Ola Electric scooter's front suspension broke while riding, claims man; shares pic
40.article_body: A man has tweeted a photo of his broken Ola Electric scooter, claiming the front suspension broke during low-speed driving. "We'd like to request that we need a replacement or design change...and save our life from...road accident due to poor material used," the Twitter user wrote. The photo shows the front tyre of the electric scooter had come off.

41.title: Key accused in last month's Sunjwan attack in J&K arrested
41.article_body: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) has arrested a key accused in connection with a terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Sunjwan in which a Central Industrial Security Force official was martyred and two Jaish-e-Mohammed terrorists were killed. NIA said the accused is an overground worker of Jaish-e-Mohammed. He was in touch with Pakistan-based handlers of the banned terror outfit.

42.title: ONGC to sell stake, seeks global help to develop fields
42.article_body: Oil and Natural Gas Corporation (ONGC) is offering a stake to global oil companies to enlist their help in developing challenging fields in India, according to a tender document. ONGC didn't disclose the size of the stake it's selling. It aims to develop the Deen Dayal West field in Bay of Bengal and the ultra-deep discoveries in Krishna Godavari Basin.

43.title: Can't stop change at national level: KCR after PM's 'pariwarwaad' remark
43.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao said on Thursday that there will soon be a change in politics at the national level which no one can stop. "Tribals, farmers and the poor aren't happy in the country. Industries are getting closed," he added. Notably, his remarks come hours after PM Narendra Modi criticised 'pariwarwaad' (dynastic politics) at an event in Hyderabad.

44.title: Sex work is a profession, police should treat sex workers with dignity: SC
44.article_body: The Supreme Court has said that sex work is a profession and its practitioners are entitled to dignity and equal protection of the law. "Police should treat all sex workers with dignity and shouldn't abuse them," the court stated. It also said that the government should educate sex workers about the legality of sex work and rights among other things.

45.title: Moody's cuts India's 2022 GDP forecast from 9.1% to 8.8%
45.article_body: Ratings agency Moody's Investors Service on Thursday lowered its GDP growth forecast for India for 2022 by 30 basis points from 9.1% to 8.8%. "Rise in crude oil, food and fertiliser prices will weigh on household finances and spending in the months ahead," Moody's noted in its report. It also slashed its forecast for advanced economies from 3.2% to 2.6%.

46.title: Actively hiring: Rival fintech startups as Klarna lays off 10% staff
46.article_body: Several rivals of Swedish fintech startup Klarna said they were actively hiring after the firm fired 10% of its 7,000 employees on Monday. London-based money transfer firm Wise's CEO tweeted, "Years of building Wise as a profitable long-term company is paying off now...can't hire people fast enough...385 open roles." Digital banking start-up Revolut said it's hiring for 250 roles.

47.title: Pakistan's SC dismisses contempt petition against ex-PM Imran Khan
47.article_body: Pakistan's Supreme Court has dismissed a contempt petition against ex-PM Imran Khan for "violating" its orders during the 'Azadi march'. Attorney General Ashtar Ausaf Ali, who filed the petition, said Khan "misled" the court as he initially took the permission for holding the rally at Islamabad's sector H-9, but he later announced that it'd be held at D-Chowk, Dawn reported.

48.title: Google pursuing licensing deals with Indian publishers: Pichai
48.article_body: Google is planning to strike licensing deals with publishers across the world and is working towards having discussions with Indian publishers in this context, Alphabet CEO Sundar Pichai said. Terming the Indian market "incredibly important", he added, "[Google realises] the critical role news plays in India...particularly with the long heritage and the fact that it works in so many languages."

49.title: Varanasi court adjourns hearing on Gyanvapi Mosque case till May 30
49.article_body: The Varanasi district court on Thursday adjourned hearing on the Gyanvapi mosque-Kashi Vishwanath temple complex dispute till May 30. This comes after the court heard the arguments of the Muslim side, which seeks dismissal of the Hindu side's civil suit. "The Muslim side's arguments on the maintainability of the case remained incomplete today," said District Government Counsel RS Singh.

50.title: Make Tamil official language like Hindi: CM Stalin while sharing stage with PM Modi
50.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin while speaking at an event attended by PM Narendra Modi in Chennai on Thursday demanded that Tamil be made the official language like Hindi in offices of the Government of India and the Madras High Court. Stalin also urged PM Modi to exempt Tamil Nadu from the national medical entrance test NEET.

51.title: India thrash Indonesia 16-0 in men's Asia Cup 2022 hockey, qualify for Super 4s
51.article_body: India on Thursday thrashed Indonesia 16-0 in their last Pool A match in men's Asia Cup 2022 hockey. With the victory, India qualified for the Super 4s along with Japan from Pool A, while Pakistan and Indonesia finished third and fourth in the group, respectively. Dipsan Tirkey scored four goals for India, while Sudev Belimagga scored a hat-trick against Indonesia.

52.title: PM Modi holds roadshow as he arrives in Chennai; video surfaces
52.article_body: PM Narendra Modi was greeted by his supporters in Chennai on Thursday as he held a roadshow upon his arrival. He was received by Tamil Nadu Governor RN Ravi, ex-CM Edappadi K Palaniswami, as well as other senior DMK ministers. PM Modi, who was in Hyderabad earlier today, will lay foundation stones for multiple infrastructure projects in Tamil Nadu.

53.title: Broadcom to acquire VMware for $61 billion in one of the largest tech deals
53.article_body: Broadcom Inc. agreed to buy cloud-computing company VMware Inc. for about $61 billion in cash and stock in one of the largest technology deals of all time. VMware shareholders will elect to receive either $142.50 in cash or 0.2520 shares of Broadcom common stock for each VMware share. Broadcom will also assume $8 billion of VMware's net debt.

54.title: COVID-19 not over yet, continue wearing masks: Maharashtra CM
54.article_body: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray urged the people of the state to continue wearing masks amid the rise in COVID-19 cases. "Although the number of hospitalisation (due to COVID-19) is low, everyone should be alert and cautious as the virus has not gone away completely as yet," he said. On Wednesday, Maharashtra reported 470 COVID-19 cases, the highest since March 5.

55.title: Cong nurtured Yasin Malik: MP Minister after Malik's sentencing
55.article_body: After Kashmiri separatist leader Yasin Malik was sentenced in a terror funding case, Madhya Pradesh Home Minister Narottam Mishra alleged that Malik was "nurtured" by the Congress. "Sonia Gandhi, Rahul Gandhi, Digvijaya Singh's tweet on Yasin Malik did not come...Yasin Malik has been convicted by the court, he himself has accepted the murder on TV," Mishra said.

56.title: Waze seeks to become approver against Deshmukh in corruption case
56.article_body: Former Mumbai Police officer Sachin Waze filed an application in the Special CBI court to become an approver against former Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh in an alleged corruption case. The CBI has accepted his application with conditions and the court will hear the case on May 30. Waze and Deshmukh are currently in jail under various charges.

57.title: PM Modi inaugurates 11 projects worth ₹31,000 crore in Tamil Nadu
57.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi laid the foundation stone of 11 projects, including a 262-km-long Bengaluru-Chennai Expressway, worth over ₹31,000 crore in Tamil Nadu on Thursday. The projects also include the redevelopment of five railway stations in the state. CM MK Stalin was also present during the event at the Jawaharlal Nehru Indoor Stadium in Chennai.

58.title: Girl tells Chhattisgarh CM she can't afford studies, he sanctions ₹3 lakh
58.article_body: During a 'Bhet Mulaqat' programme in Chhattisgarh's Chitrakoot area, a girl named Lokeshwari told CM Bhupesh Baghel that she can't study due to financial issues as her father died 15 years ago. Baghel immediately instructed the in-charge of Bastar district to sanction financial assistance of ₹3 lakh to her. A picture of the interaction between them has surfaced online.

59.title: Africa CDC warns over hoarding of vaccines amid monkeypox outbreak
59.article_body: Africa Centres for Disease Control and Prevention has warned against the hoarding of vaccines amid the monkeypox outbreak. Ahmed Ogwell Ouma, the Deputy Director of Africa CDC, said, "Vaccines should go...where [they're] needed the most...so based on risk and not on who can be able to buy it." Several countries, including the UK and the US, have reported monkeypox cases.

60.title: 2 members of Gogi gang detained in Delhi; guns & cartridges seized
60.article_body: Delhi Police said that they have detained two alleged members of the Gogi gang, led by slain gangster Jitender Gogi, and recovered two guns and 20 live cartridges from them. DCP (outer north) Brijendra Kumar Yadav said that the detained accused are "sharpshooters" and minors. Police added that the two allegedly planned to kill the father of gangster Neeraj Bawana.

61.title: Apple sends 36 kg repair kit to man in US to fix his iPhone 13 mini
61.article_body: The Verge's Sean Hollister revealed he recently opted to repair his iPhone 13 mini by using Apple's self-service repair programme in US. He said Apple sent him a toolkit in two suitcases weighing 79 pounds (36 kg) to fix a 1.1 ounce (0.03 kg) battery. Hollister added the entire process was full of challenges and the manual wasn't very helpful.

62.title: CBI arrests Customs appraiser, aide in Delhi in bribery case
62.article_body:
The CBI has arrested an appraiser of the Customs Department and his associate at the Delhi airport for allegedly seeking bribe of ₹1.40 lakh, officials said. The accused demanded the bribe from a businessman to clear a consignment of batteries to South Africa, officials added. 
CBI spokesperson said they arrested the accused while they were allegedly accepting ₹1 lakh bribe.

63.title: Death toll rises to 19 in Iran building collapse, over 35 injured
63.article_body: The death toll from the collapse of a 10-storey commercial building in Iran's Abadan city has risen to 19, a local official was quoted as saying. Meanwhile, an official said that over 35 people have been rescued from the rubble and added that they're undergoing treatment in the hospitals. Reportedly, 10 people have been arrested by police over the incident.

64.title: Won't back Sweden, Finland's NATO bids unless measures taken: Turkey
64.article_body: Turkey will not back Sweden and Finland's respective bids to join NATO unless the countries take "concrete steps" to address the former's security concerns, a senior Turkish official said on Wednesday. This comes after delegations from Sweden and Finland met Turkish officials for talks in Ankara. Turkey has accused the countries of having links with a Kurdish militant group.

65.title: IAS officer shares pic of gutkha spit inside plane; says 'someone left their identity'
65.article_body: IAS officer Awanish Sharan shared a picture of gutkha spit next to a seat inside a plane and wrote, "Somebody left their identity." Reacting to the picture, IPS officer Suraj Singh Parihar tweeted, "Who leaves behind their upbringing, culture like this?" Meanwhile, another Twitter user wrote, "Inexcusable. He can be tracked back and punished and penalised."

66.title: Stage at Hyd airport shows PM Modi is on political visit: TRS leader
66.article_body: TRS leader Krishank Manne shared the picture of a stage set up at Hyderabad International Airport ahead of PM Narendra Modi's visit to the city. "This stage at the airport explains that PM isn't just on an official visit but also a political visit," Krishank said. "In that case, PM Modi should answer many pending promises of Telangana," he added.

67.title: Rape survivor tries to set herself ablaze over police inaction in UP
67.article_body: A rape survivor attempted to set herself on fire outside a police station in UP's Baghpat after being upset over police inaction in her case. The woman alleged that her in-laws used to harass her for dowry and that her husband's brother raped her and shot a video to blackmail her. It's also alleged she was gangraped by four men.

68.title: 4 tourists arrested for offering prayers on Taj Mahal premises
68.article_body: At least four tourists were arrested for offering prayers at the Shahi mosque on Taj Mahal premises, police said on Thursday. The individuals, who hail from Hyderabad and Azamgarh, were booked under section 153 of the IPC, which punishes "provoking with intent to cause riots". Offering 'namaz' inside the monument's premises is only permitted on Friday, an ASI official said.

69.title: Delhi woman plans own kidnapping to extort money from brother; held
69.article_body: A 38-year-old woman has been arrested for allegedly plotting her own kidnapping to extort money from her brother, Delhi Police said on Thursday. The woman converted her voice to sound like a man using an app and sent it to her brother for ransom. She also sent pictures to her brother showing her gagged with her hands tied.

70.title: Excellent meet: British High Commissioner after meeting Punjab CM
70.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann met the British High Commissioner to India, Alex Ellis, at his residence in Chandigarh on Thursday. Informing about the meeting, CM Mann said, "Discussed the prospects of partnership in education, IT and various other sectors." Meanwhile, Ellis tweeted, "Excellent first meeting with...CM Bhagwant Mann. Discussed opportunities on Punjab-UK flights, sports [and] trade."

71.title: Shell in talks with Indian consortium to sell Russian LNG plant stake: Report
71.article_body: Shell is in talks with a consortium of Indian energy companies, including ONGC Videsh and GAIL, to sell its 27.5% stake in Russia's Sakhalin-2 LNG plant, Reuters reported. Shell had said in February that it'd shut down all its operations in Russia. It's also asking the Indian consortium for separate bids for long-term LNG supply deals it has with Sakhalin-2.

72.title: People in courtroom laugh as judge jokingly calls Depp's lawyer a 'snarky guy'
72.article_body: The judge jokingly called Johnny Depp's attorney a "snarky guy" as the whole courtroom burst into laughter. The moment came at the end of hearing an emergency motion to intervene filed by TMZ. Depp's lawyer previously said TMZ wasn't comparable to major news outlets and noted he wasn't trying to be "snarky", following which the judge said, "You're just...a...snarky guy."

73.title: Train arrives 20 minutes early in MP; video shows passengers doing garba to celebrate
73.article_body: A video is going viral on social media, showing train passengers performing garba at Madhya Pradesh's Ratlam railway platform after their train reportedly arrived 20 minutes earlier than scheduled on Wednesday. Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw also shared the video and tweeted, "Majama! Happy Journey." It was a Bandra-Haridwar train that reportedly had a stop time of 10 minutes.

74.title: India has never been a large importer of Russian oil: Piyush Goyal
74.article_body: Union Minister Piyush Goyal, while speaking at the World Economic Forum in Davos, said that India has never been a very large importer of petroleum products from Russia. "India always looked at diversified sources for our petroleum requirements," Goyal stated. He added that any suggestion that India is increasing imports from Russia doesn't stand scrutiny.

75.title: After 2014, India is witnessing political willpower & reforms: PM
75.article_body: PM Narendra Modi while speaking in Hyderabad on Thursday said, "If we compare last eight years with the previous three decades, we'll see that reforms couldn't take place...due to a lack of political willpower and instability." "After 2014, India is witnessing political willpower and reforms," he said. PM Modi participated in the 20th-anniversary celebrations of the Indian School of Business.

76.title: Pune police official's son killed; college friend & husband booked
76.article_body: A police official's son was allegedly murdered by his college friend and her husband in Pune's Hadapsar area on Tuesday night. According to the police, the 21-year-old victim was attacked by the woman, her husband and three other people, all of whom have been booked under murder charges. The husband was reportedly unhappy about his wife's friendship with the victim.

77.title: Vedanta to finalise location of $20 bn semiconductor plant by June
77.article_body: Vedanta Chairman Anil Agarwal told Reuters that the company will finalise a location for its $20 billion semiconductor and display plants in India by mid-June. "You have to create another Taiwan in India," Agarwal said, adding that Vedanta's first chip product will be ready in two years. Taiwan's Foxconn will have technical responsibility for the operation, he added.

78.title: Cong's Harish Rawat sits on protest on U'khand highway; video surfaces
78.article_body: Former Uttarakhand Chief Minister and Congress leader Harish Rawat staged a sit-in protest at the Haldwani highway in the state to highlight the condition of the road. In a video shared by his office, the Congress leader is seen sitting near a pothole. Rawat said he was ready to be arrested for protesting over the issue.

79.title: India providing critical humanitarian aid to Afghanistan: US praises India
79.article_body: US Special Envoy for Afghanistan Thomas West on Thursday praised India for supporting Afghanistan's public. "India is providing critical humanitarian aid, has interests to protect, brings enormous capability and experience to supporting Afghan people," the US envoy tweeted. India has supplied tonnes of wheat, winter clothing, essential medications and doses of Covaxin to Afghanistan.

80.title: 7 yrs worth of foreign portfolio investments wiped out in 8 months
80.article_body: Foreign Portfolio Investors (FPIs) have net sold Indian stocks worth ₹2.5 lakh crore since October 2021, as per data available on National Securities Depository Limited (NSDL). This is more than the net investment of ₹2.2 lakh crore made by FPIs between 2014 and 2020, data showed. Meanwhile, domestic retail investors net invested ₹2.1 lakh crore in 2021 and 2022.

81.title: 31 arrested, 4 women rescued after raid at dance bar in Mumbai
81.article_body: At least 31 persons were arrested and four women were rescued after the police and the social service branch conducted a raid at Pushpak Bar in Mumbai's Kalina area. During the raid, eight women were found on the premises, despite the owner having permission to employ only four women. The police arrested 21 patrons and 11 employees of the bar.

82.title: WB to move bill to appoint CM as chancellor of state universities instead of Guv
82.article_body: The West Bengal Cabinet has decided to introduce a bill to appoint Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee as the chancellor of all state universities instead of Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar. This comes amid a frequent war of words between Dhankhar and Banerjee. State Minister Bratya Basu said this will be taken to the Assembly for the Act to be amended.

83.title: Yasin Malik won't be given any work in Tihar, will be alone in jail no. 7: Officials
83.article_body: J&K separatist leader Yasin Malik will not be assigned any work at Tihar jail due to security reasons, will be lodged alone inside jail number 7 and will not be entitled to any parole or furlough during his prison term, officials said. "Malik's security will be routinely monitored by the Intelligence Bureau besides jail officers," a prison officer added.

84.title: Putin will not dictate Ukraine peace terms: German Chancellor
84.article_body: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz said that Russian President Vladimir Putin would not dictate the terms of any peace agreement, "Ukraine will not accept that, and neither will we". "A capture of the whole of Ukraine seems further away now than at the beginning of the war," Scholz added, saying he is "convinced" that Putin will not win the Ukraine war.

85.title: Dhoni is 1 in a billion product, has mind like 5-star General: Ex-trainer
85.article_body: Talking about MS Dhoni, ex-India trainer Ramji Srinivasan said, "MSD is an enigma and like Sachin Tendulkar, is one in a billion product." "He has amazing [reflexes] like a...[F1] driver and...mind like [a] 5-star General," added Srinivasan. "Very few can match [his] fitness...[at] that age," he stated. "Dhoni does what suits him, be it strength work...or hybrid work," said Srinivasan.

86.title: There’s no comparison, we are all one industry: Raveena on north-south debate
86.article_body: Speaking about the north-south debate, actress Raveena Tandon said that all this chatter is "overhyped" about what is right and wrong with which industry. "Even 'KGF' and 'RRR' are ballpark figures. When you compare two Hindi films' business only, our films have also done that well," she added. Raveena said there is no comparison as they are all one industry.

87.title: He created a problem straightaway at Man Utd: Gary Neville on Ronaldo
87.article_body: Former Manchester United player Gary Neville said Cristiano Ronaldo's arrival at Manchester United in 2021 created a problem straightaway, adding that it upset the dynamic in the dressing room for midfielder Bruno Fernandes. "[Edinson Cavani] was being pleaded to stay and lead the attack for the year, but when they signed Ronaldo, Cavani was shot then and finished," stated Neville.

88.title: 8 years of BJP govt marked by 'misery', 'misgovernance': Congress
88.article_body: Congress on Thursday criticised the BJP government ahead of its eighth anniversary alleging that this period has been marked by 'misery' and 'misgovernance'. "While high prices are upsetting the budgets of common people...on the other [hand], communal fires are flaring," said Randeep Surjewala at a press conference. Congress also released a booklet highlighting 'failures' of the BJP government.

89.title: Fill Kozhikode runway end with sand to arrest overshooting aircraft: Panel
89.article_body: A high-level committee which had been appointed to look into the Kozhikode crash that killed 21 people in August 2020 has recommended that the end of the 90-metre Runway End Safety Area (RESA) should be filled with sand or soil. The committee said that the sand or soil should have a depth of fifteen centimetres to arrest an overshooting aircraft.

90.title: Rahul didn't need political clearance for his London visit: Congress
90.article_body: Speaking on reports that Rahul Gandhi had no political clearance for London visit, Congress spokesperson Randeep Singh Surjewala said, "If you are a minister or holding a public office or a government official, then you need political clearance." "Rahul as a parliamentarian only needed FCRA clearance. We still are a democratic country and don't live in stone age," Surjewala added.

91.title: It’s not possible to win polls through CBI: Jharkhand Congress chief
91.article_body: Following CBI raids at Ranchi residences of ex-Jharkhand minister and Congress leader Bandhu Tirkey, state Congress chief Rajesh Thakur said agenda behind such raids by CBI is clear. "If someone wants to win elections through CBI then it's not possible," Thakur added. "It's the people who will decide. Yesterday the polls were notified and raids were conducted today," Thakur stated.

92.title: Told her all wrong things: Neena on marriage advice she gave to daughter Masaba
92.article_body: When asked what advice she gave to her daughter Masaba Gupta about marriage and relationships, actress Neena Gupta said, "Wahi sab galat cheezein boli maine. Wahi ghise peeti baatein jo har maa bolti hai (I told her all...wrong things, the same talk mothers give to their daughters)." On the professional front, Neena was recently seen in 'Panchayat 2'.

93.title: Ex-Sri Lankan PM Mahinda Rajapaksa probed over May 9 clashes
93.article_body: Ex-Sri Lankan PM Mahinda Rajapaksa was probed by authorities over clashes that broke out in Colombo earlier this month amid the country's ongoing economic crisis. Rajapaksa gave a three-hour-long statement to Sri Lankan police amid allegations that his party's supporters attacked anti-government protesters on May 9. At least 10 people died and over 200 others were injured due to clashes.

94.title: It's a blessing to have her home: Nick Jonas on his daughter Malti
94.article_body: During his appearance on 'The Kelly Clarkson Show', singer Nick Jonas called his daughter a “blessing” in his life. He said, "She’s the best. It’s just been a magical season in our life. Also pretty wild, but it’s a blessing to have her home. It’s been wonderful." Actress Priyanka Chopra and Nick Jonas welcomed their first child, Malti, this January.

95.title: We'll come back stronger: Gautam Gambhir after LSG's exit from IPL 2022
95.article_body: After LSG lost to RCB in the IPL 2022 Eliminator, LSG mentor Gautam Gambhir said it was a "great tournament" for them and they'll come back stronger next season. The KL Rahul-led side won nine of their 14 league games to enter the playoffs but suffered defeat by 14 runs against RCB in the Eliminator on Wednesday.

96.title: Putin weaponising hunger, trying to hold world to ransom: UK
96.article_body: UK Foreign Secretary Liz Truss on Thursday said that Russian President Vladimir Putin "needs to remove the blockade on Ukrainian grain". "It is completely appalling that Putin is trying to hold the world to ransom and he is essentially weaponising hunger and lack of food amongst the poorest people around the world," she said.

97.title: He's always the favourite in French Open even if injured: Goran on Nadal
97.article_body: Former Wimbledon-winning Croatian Goran Ivanisevic said Rafael Nadal will always be the favourite in French Open even if he injured. "[Roland Garros] is his home, [Philippe-Chatrier is] his court," added Goran. "Whether he plays well or badly, under the sun or not, it changes nothing," he stated. "[Nadal] is incredible, I have enormous respect for him," said Goran.

98.title: More women should contest and win elections: President Ram Nath Kovind
98.article_body: Inaugurating National Women Legislators' Conference in Kerala on Thursday, President Ram Nath Kovind called for better participation of women in Indian politics. "There should be far more of you [women] contesting and winning the elections," he said. "They [women] have suffered from deep-rooted social prejudices. Their proportion in the workforce is nowhere near their potential," he added.

99.title: Thieves end up burning ₹19 lakh in attempt to rob ATM in Bengaluru
99.article_body: Bengaluru City Police have registered a case after some thieves ended up burning currency notes worth over ₹19 lakh in an attempt to steal money from an ATM of Canara Bank. They were reportedly trying to open the ATM with a gas cutter when the notes got burnt. The security firm responsible for managing the ATM has filed the case.

100.title: Gautam Gambhir's pic with KL Rahul after LSG's exit from IPL 2022 goes viral
100.article_body: A picture of LSG mentor Gautam Gambhir with captain KL Rahul following the team's defeat against RCB in IPL 2022 Eliminator has gone viral. "OMG the death stare," a fan commented on the picture. "GG to KL: 'kar diya Misbah wali harkat'," wrote another fan. Rahul was dismissed in the 19th over for 79(58) as LSG lost by 14 runs.

101.title: Former BJP corporator, son injured in group clash in MP's Rewa
101.article_body: A former BJP corporator, Lavkush Gupta, and his son were injured in a clash between two communities in Madhya Pradesh's Rewa district on Wednesday evening. According to police, the clash erupted following an argument over a tract of land near a temple and a mosque in Malakpur area. Following the incident, heavy security has been deployed in the area.

102.title: BBMP grants more powers to zonal commissioners
102.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) issued an order giving more administrative and financial powers to zonal commissioners. As per the order, zonal commissioners' approval will be mandatory for administrative and executive works while revenue, forest, animal husbandry, infrastructure, stormwater drains, engineering, health and town planning departments will operate under their own heads.

103.title: Private university VC arrested for businessman's 'suicide' in Assam
103.article_body: A private university’s vice-chancellor (VC) was arrested in Assam in connection with the death of a businessman. Primary investigation suggests it's a case of suicide, police said. The businessman was the owner of a resort on the outskirts of Guwahati. He blamed Assam Don Bosco University’s VC, Father Stephen Mavely, for "mental harassment" which led him to take this step.

104.title: Delhi HC allows Sharjeel Imam to approach trial court for interim bail
104.article_body: Delhi HC allowed JNU research student Sharjeel Imam to approach the trial court to seek interim bail in the sedition case. The case was filed in connection with the speeches delivered by him at Jamia Millia Islamia University and Aligarh Muslim University. Sharjeel Imam had moved an application before HC citing the recent Supreme Court order on IPC Section 124A.

105.title: Don't think captaincy has anything to do with Pant's form in IPL 2022: Chawla
105.article_body: Cricketer-commentator Piyush Chawla has said he would like to see Rishabh Pant leading DC again next IPL season as the 24-year-old is a "street-smart cricketer, who will only improve as he keeps leading". On Pant's form in IPL 2022, Chawla said, "I don't think captaincy had anything to do with his batting...I wouldn't even say that his form was bad."

106.title: 28-yr-old Indian man goes missing while on a solo trip to Azerbaijan; brother seeks help
106.article_body: A 28-year-old Indian named Manikanth Kondaveeti, on a solo trip to Azerbaijan, has gone missing. Seeking help, his brother said Manikanth hasn't been responding to their calls since May 12, adding that he was planning a hike in a forest in one of their last conversations. "Foreign ministry of India is trying its best to locate him," he stated.

107.title: Russia to expel reporters from West if YouTube blocks govt briefings
107.article_body: Russia's foreign ministry has said Western countries' reporters will be expelled from Russia if YouTube blocks access to its spokeswoman Maria Zakharova's briefings. Russia has passed a bill giving prosecutors powers to shut foreign media bureaus if a Western country has been "unfriendly" to Russian media. "We...told them: 'You block another briefing, one journalist...goes home'," Zakharova said.

108.title: You'll see me more on roads than in Raj Nivas: Newly-appointed Delhi LG
108.article_body: Soon after taking oath as 22nd Lieutenant Governor of Delhi, Vinai Kumar Saxena said that he will work as a "local guardian" in the national capital. "You'll see me more on roads than in Raj Nivas," Saxena said. "Pollution is a major issue in Delhi, will try to solve this problem...People working in unorganised sector will be trained," he added.

109.title: You shouldn't be allowed to make films: Actor Patton Oswalt on 'RRR'
109.article_body: Talking about the film 'RRR', actor Patton Oswalt tweeted, "[It's] insane. You guys are out of your [f***ing] minds." "You should not be allowed to make films," added Oswalt in his tweet. The SS Rajamouli-directorial starring Ram Charan and Jr NTR crossed the ₹1,000-crore mark globally in 16 days of its release. 'RRR' also featured Ajay Devgn and Alia Bhatt.

110.title: 10 arrested for raising anti-national slogans outside Yasin Malik's home
110.article_body: Police have arrested 10 people for allegedly raising anti-national slogans and pelting stones outside Jammu and Kashmir Liberation Front (JKLF) chief Yasin Malik's residence in Srinagar on Wednesday before his sentencing. "The main instigators of this hooliganism will be booked," police said. "Such anti-national activities and provocative posture will always be dealt [with] strictly," they added.

111.title: Mob burns alive suspected drug dealers in a house in South Africa
111.article_body: South African police said they are on high alert after three men accused of being drug dealers were burnt alive inside a house by a mob on Tuesday afternoon. The men allegedly stabbed and injured some of the attackers while attempting to escape, but the victims were forced back to the house before it was set alight, the police added.

112.title: Axis Mutual Fund ropes in Deloitte to probe front-running scam: Report
112.article_body: Axis Mutual Fund (MF) has roped in Deloitte as a second investigator to probe the front-running scam at the firm, Times Now reported citing The Economic Times. Alvarez and Marsal is already involved in the investigation. This comes after market regulator SEBI had reportedly asked Axis MF to pin down the precise modus operandi in the case.

113.title: I get to do what B'wood hero does everyday: Dilip on playing Jethalal for 14 yrs
113.article_body: When asked if he had any hint that playing 'Jethalal' was going to be quite a long journey, actor Dilip Joshi said, "Honestly...I enjoy playing Jetha even today as an actor...I am doing everything a Hindi film hero gets to do, every day." "We have celebrated each festival and occasion with so much zest on the show," he added.

114.title: Realised needs are more important than acting, did odd jobs: Panchayat actor
114.article_body: 'Panchayat' actor Faisal Malik said that when he came to Mumbai to become an actor, he realised that meeting basic needs is more important than acting. "I started doing odd jobs at production houses...From putting tapes into cameras to managing floor...and other odd jobs, I have done it all. Whatever I know today, I learnt while working here," he added.

115.title: Putin hikes Russians' pensions, downplays impact of Ukraine op
115.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin ordered a 10% hike in citizens' pensions and the minimum wage amid inflation. He admitted that 2022 would be a difficult year for Russia's economy but said all the difficulties were not related to the military operation in Ukraine. He added that inflation in North America and Europe was comparable and "even more" than Russia.

116.title: BJP ministers to visit over 140 constituencies the party lost in 2019
116.article_body: In order to step up preparations for the 2024 Lok Sabha elections, the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) on Wednesday asked its ministers to visit over 140 constituencies across the country, where the party lost in 2019. The ministers will visit the constituencies from May 25 to July 31 and interact with party workers and beneficiaries of government welfare schemes.

117.title: Man molests minor niece in Mumbai, threatens to kill her brother
117.article_body: A 34-year-old man has been booked for allegedly molesting his 13-year-old niece in Mumbai, an official said on Wednesday. The accused also threatened to kill the girl's 10-year-old brother, who was playing outside their residence, when she resisted the assault and tried to raise an alarm. The girl's parents were away for some work when the incident took place.

118.title: Will abolish minority reservations if BJP comes to power in T'gana: Sanjay Kumar
118.article_body: Bharatiya Janata Party's Telangana President and MP Bandi Sanjay Kumar on Wednesday said if his party comes to power in the state, the reservations for minorities will be abolished. The benefit would be provided to the Scheduled Castes (SCs), Scheduled Tribes (STs) and the poor among upper castes, he added. He also vowed to work against religious conversions in Telangana.

119.title: Accident at Iran's sensitive military site kills engineer
119.article_body: An engineer died after an unexplained accident on Wednesday in a research centre at the Parchin military site affiliated with Iran's Defence Ministry, the semi-official Fars news agency reported. Parchin is a sensitive military site housing many industrial and research units, where Western security services suspect Iran conducted tests related to nuclear bomb detonations over a decade ago.

120.title: Mangalore University students protest against Muslim girls wearing hijab
120.article_body: Students of Mangalore University sat on protest against Muslim girls who came to the classroom wearing hijab. The students demanded that the girl students who were wearing hijab should not be allowed inside the college. They sat on protest outside the college campus and reportedly said that the girls must follow High Court's order and remove their hijab.

121.title: Interest rate hikes likely to not cause prolonged stress: Axis Bank CEO
121.article_body: Some stress will be built in the system due to interest rate hikes, but it will likely not be prolonged, said Axis Bank MD and CEO Amitabh Chaudhry. "When you look at larger banks and large institutions, people have beefed up their balance sheet in a very significant manner," Chaudhry said. "I'm not anticipating any large NPA problems," he added.

122.title: Video of Johnny Depp smiling after his ex-girlfriend Kate Moss testified goes viral
122.article_body: Viewers noticed Johnny Depp smiling as Kate Moss testified in his defamation trial against ex-wife Amber Heard. Moss testified via video link, during which she denied Heard's claim that Depp pushed her down the stairs. The model, who dated Depp between 1994 and 1998, said she did fall down a staircase and he had helped her up at the time.

123.title: Fire breaks out at scrap godown in Gurugram; 5 fire tenders at spot
123.article_body: A fire broke out in a scrap godown located in Sector 17-18 in Gurugram on Thursday afternoon, ANI reported. Sudhir Singh, a Fire Department official, said that five fire tenders reached the spot to douse the blaze and added that no casualties have been reported so far. The cause of the fire is yet to be ascertained.

124.title: 'Pariwarwaad' is democracy's biggest enemy: PM Modi in Hyderabad
124.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday criticised 'pariwarwaad' (dynastic politics) while addressing an event in Hyderabad, claiming that it's not just a political problem but rather a democracy's biggest enemy. He added that BJP wants to develop the state as a technology hub, stating that "change in Telangana is certain". Telangana will head to the polls next year.

125.title: Kohli imitates WWE gesture as policeman carries pitch invader on shoulders, video viral
125.article_body: A video has gone viral showing Virat Kohli imitating WWE gesture after a policeman carried a pitch invader on shoulders to escort him out of the ground. The fan had entered the ground during the last over of LSG's innings in the IPL 2022 Eliminator against RCB at Eden Gardens. Kohli was fielding in the deep when the incident happened.

126.title: India moving forward with dream of 'Aatmanirbhar Bharat': PM in Hyd
126.article_body: PM Narendra Modi while speaking in Hyderabad on Thursday said the 21st century India is moving forward with the dream of 'Aatmanirbhar Bharat' and 'Make in India'. "Our startups are leaving an impression on the world. Today, we're the world's third-largest startup ecosystem," he added. PM Modi participated in the 20th-anniversary celebrations and graduation programme of Indian School of Business.

127.title: 7-8 feared dead after vehicle falls into deep gorge in J&K at Zojila Pass
127.article_body: Around seven-eight people are feared to have died after a vehicle fell into a deep gorge at Zojila Pass, the Disaster Management Authority of the Jammu and Kashmir government said. The vehicle, on its way from Kargil to Srinagar, reportedly skidded off the road and fell around 400-500 feet down, it added. Police are ascertaining the cause of the incident.

128.title: Apple to keep iPhone production flat in 2022: Report
128.article_body: Apple is planning to keep iPhone production roughly flat at about 220 million units in 2022, Reuters reported citing Bloomberg on Thursday. This comes as China's COVID-19 curbs, supply chain issues and cooling demand continue to hurt smartphone makers. Apple said that any new lockdowns in China and Taiwan could bring new supply and demand-related obstacles.

129.title: 10 arrested for stone pelting outside Yasin Malik's house in J&K
129.article_body: J&K Police have arrested 10 people for stone pelting and anti-national sloganeering outside separatist leader Yasin Malik's house in Srinagar. Several supporters of Malik clashed with security personnel and pelted stones during the protests, which were held prior to his sentencing. Malik has been sentenced to life imprisonment in the 2017 terror funding case by an NIA court in Delhi.

130.title: Sidhu's 7-meal diet plan in jail surfaces; sauteed vegetables, tofu, lassi included
130.article_body: A panel of doctors has prepared a seven-meal diet plan for cricketer-turned-politician Navjot Singh Sidhu, who is serving a year-long jail sentence in a road rage case involving a man's death. Lactose-free milk, avocado, paneer, fruits, sauteed vegetables, tofu and lassi are some of the items on his plan. A jails department official called the plan a "seven-star hotel menu".

131.title: Best innings by an uncapped player that I've seen: Karthik on Patidar's 112*(54)
131.article_body: RCB wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik praised teammate Rajat Patidar for his unbeaten 112-run innings against LSG, stating that it was probably the best innings by an uncapped player that he has ever seen. "He's very cool, very calm, very shy personality actually, very quiet person," added Karthik. Patidar's knock helped RCB post 207/4 in the game.

132.title: NCP office-bearer allegedly attacked by BJP member in Pune
132.article_body: NCP office-bearer Appa Jadhav was attacked at his office allegedly by former BJP member Santosh Kamble and others at Narayan Peth in Pune on Wednesday. Kamble and his associates have been booked on charges of rioting. Kamble is a former office-bearer of the BJP but he doesn't hold any post in the party at present.

133.title: Unacademy CEO tells staff funding could dry up for 18 months: Report
133.article_body: Unacademy CEO Gaurav Munjal in an email to employees said the startup is "looking at a time where funding will dry up for at least 12-18 months. Some...are predicting that this might last 24 months," media reports said. "This is a test for all of us...We must focus on profitability at all costs. We must survive the winter," he added.

134.title: Marcos Jr proclaimed next President of Philippines by Congress
134.article_body: Ferdinand Marcos Jr, son of the former dictator, was proclaimed the next President of the Philippines by Congress on Wednesday. Sara Duterte, daughter of the outgoing President Rodrigo Duterte, was declared as the Vice President. Marcos Jr had won the presidential election by a huge margin, bagging about double the number of votes his rival secured.

135.title: Lot of people haven't appreciated me, thought I'm a bully: Urvashi Dholakia
135.article_body: Actress Urvashi Dholakia said a lot of people haven't appreciated her. "[A lot] of people find me to be...strong-headed, like a bully. But I'm not. I have just been a woman who has her own opinions," she added. "I've been like this since I was a kid. Whether you like it or you don't, that's not my problem," Urvashi said.

136.title: Delhi Police's 'Book your space. Possession soon' ad for criminals goes viral
136.article_body: Delhi Police has released a 'room vacant' ad for criminals and wrote, "'Book' your space. Possession soon. The living offer you certainly CAN resist!" It mentioned facilities like free beds and meals, bathrooms on sharing basis and fully CCTV campus among others. "Well-ventilated (you can actually wave at the other occupants)," the ad read.

137.title: Lido Learning's 1,200 workers who were told to resign yet to receive Jan salary: Report
137.article_body: Edtech startup Lido Learning is yet to pay salaries for January to over 1,200 employees who were asked to resign abruptly in February first week, Moneycontrol reported citing sources. Earlier this month, employees received 'full and final settlement' letter from Lido Learning, however, they haven't received anything yet. The employees were asked to resign over video call, citing funding crunch.

138.title: Dibakar said 'We'll put false negative stories, that gets more eyeballs': Abhay
138.article_body: Actor Abhay Deol said that filmmaker Dibakar Banerjee told him that some false negative stories will deliberately be put out because that gets more eyeballs. "They got a journalist who I had a contentious relationship with...so he put negative stories about me only...So, I got very upset with Dibakar...and now those stories are out and they're completely false," Abhay added.

139.title: Injuries to Washington, Natarajan threw us off: SRH coach Moody
139.article_body: SRH head coach Tom Moody has said injuries to Washington Sundar and T Natarajan threw them off and made it difficult to "recapture the winning momentum" in IPL 2022. SRH started the season with two defeats before going on a five-match winning streak. However, they then lost five games in a row to subsequently finish eighth on the points table.

140.title: Central probe agencies shouldn't misuse powers: Ajit Pawar
140.article_body: Central investigation agencies have the right to search and raid but they should not "misuse powers", Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar said. His comment came in reaction to the ED raids at locations linked to Maharashtra Transport Minister Anil Parab. "All I want to say is that action should be held in a transparent manner," Pawar added.

141.title: What are the major announcements made in Uttar Pradesh Budget 2022-23?
141.article_body: Presenting Uttar Pradesh Budget 2022-23, state Finance Minister Suresh Kumar Khanna said the target is to make UP's economy $1 trillion in size. The old-age pension in UP has been increased from ₹500 to ₹1,000. UP has set aside ₹720 crore for women's safety projects. UP has allocated ₹560 crore for Ayushman Cards and ₹2,100 crore for 14 medical colleges.

142.title: Conspiracy to defame state govt: Raut on ED raids linked to Maha minister
142.article_body: Following raids conducted by ED at locations linked to Maharashtra Transport Minister and Shiv Sena leader Anil Parab, party leader Sanjay Raut said that BJP is using the central government agencies against the Opposition. "We are in support of Anil Parab…This is just a conspiracy to defame the Maharashtra government," Raut added.

143.title: B'luru to get IKEA store in June, K'taka CM invited for inauguration
143.article_body: Swedish furniture retailer IKEA will inaugurate its first store in Bengaluru in June with an investment of ₹1,000 crore. The store will be inaugurated in Bengaluru's Nagasandra area by the Ingka Group's CEO, Jesper Brodin, who has also invited Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai for the event. The Bengaluru store would be IKEA's third store in India after Mumbai and Hyderabad.

144.title: Shameful: Union Min on Delhi stadium being vacated for IAS officer's walk with dog
144.article_body: After reports that athletes and coaches practising at Delhi's Thyagraj Stadium were forced to wrap training by 7 pm so that Delhi's Principal Secretary (Revenue) Sanjeev Khirwar can walk his dog, Union Minister Kaushal Kishore criticised Khirwar and called the act "misuse of authority". "It's shameful that sportspersons have to empty stadium premises...The officer should apologise," Kishore said.

145.title: Pune civic body cancels planned water cut in view of President's visit
145.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has decided to cancel the planned water cut on Thursday in view of President Ram Nath Kovind's visit to the city. Earlier, the civic body had announced that several parts of the city will not receive water due to repair work on Thursday. The areas that were to be affected included Shivajinagar and Cantonment.

146.title: Karti Chidambaram granted protection from arrest in visa scam case
146.article_body: A Delhi court has granted interim protection from arrest till May 30 to Congress MP Karti Chidambaram in the alleged money laundering case registered by the Enforcement Directorate in connection with the bribe-for-visa case. Chidambaram is accused of receiving ₹50 lakh as bribe for re-issuance of project visas for 263 Chinese nationals. He has denied all allegations levelled against him.

147.title: Crocodiles in South Africa are losing teeth to lead poisoning: Study
147.article_body: A study of Nile crocodiles in South Africa's St Lucia Lake found that lead poisoning caused due to lead-based fishing weights is making reptiles lose their teeth. Massively high lead levels were found in their blood. The lead poisoning occurred when reptiles scooped up stones from lake's floor to help them with digestion causing anaemia and fragmented teeth, study stated.

148.title: El Salvador extends anti-gang emergency for 30 more days
148.article_body: The anti-gang emergency in El Salvador will continue for 30 more days as the Congress approved an extension sought by President Nayib Bukele. The emergency was first declared in March in view of the rise in gang killings. "We are going to continue to confront this cancer…this war will continue until the gangs are eradicated," said Security Minister Gustavo Villatoro.

149.title: What multiple records did RCB's Patidar break with his 112*(54) in IPL 2022 Eliminator?
149.article_body: RCB batter Rajat Patidar became the first uncapped player in IPL history to smash a century in playoffs. He reached his hundred off 49 deliveries, the fastest hundred of IPL 2022. Patidar's 112*(54) is the third-highest score by an uncapped player in IPL history. Patidar is also the first RCB cricketer to hit a hundred in IPL playoffs.

150.title: Was rushed to hospital after 'Elvis', body started shutting down: Austin Butler
150.article_body: Actor Austin Butler said that he was rushed to the hospital the day after he finished shooting for his upcoming movie 'Elvis'. "I woke up at 4 in the morning with excruciating pain...My body just started shutting down," he added. Reports said that he was diagnosed with a virus and was bedridden for a week before recovering from the illness.

151.title: Leopard suspected to have attacked 3-yr-old boy rescued in Pune
151.article_body: Maharashtra forest department has rescued a leopard which is believed to have attacked a three-year-old boy in a village in Pune district's Shirur last week. The boy, who was attacked by the leopard in open yard near a sugarcane field, sustained injuries to his neck and chest and is undergoing treatment. The animal has been sent to a rescue centre.

152.title: 14 relatives get life term for double murder over land dispute in UP
152.article_body: A local court has sentenced 14 persons, including 3 women, to life imprisonment in a 2015 double murder case that took place in Deoria’s Mundera village in UP. All 14 persons are relatives and the court has also imposed a fine on them. "The murders were a fallout of a land dispute," District Government Counsel, Deoria, Rajesh Kumar Mishra, said.

153.title: Germany to recognise Covaxin for travel purposes from June 1
153.article_body: German Ambassador to India Walter J Lindner said Germany will start recognising Bharat Biotech's COVID-19 vaccine for travel purposes from June 1. "The embassy has been pushing very actively for such decision (because of Covid-backlogs visa sections have longer waiting periods than normal, please have patience)," Lindner added. WHO in November last year issued an Emergency Use Listing for Covaxin.

154.title: List of world's 10 best cities to work from home released
154.article_body: Singapore is the world's best city to work from home, according to a study released by mobile access technology company Kisi. It is followed by Washington, Austin, Bern, Zurich, Geneva, San Francisco, Boston, Stockholm and Liverpool. Kisi analysed data from the Journal of Public Economics and World Bank.

155.title: Be careful while downloading remote access apps: Pune Police to citizens
155.article_body: Amid rising cases of cyber frauds, Pune Police have asked people to be careful while downloading remote desktop applications like 'AnyDesk' or 'TeamViewer QuickSupport' when prompted by unknown people over phone. Fraudsters are using these applications to get confidential bank account information and transfer money to their accounts, police warned. The victims, in most cases, are senior citizens.

156.title: Harsh Vardhan walks out of Delhi L-G's oath ceremony, says 'They didn't keep seats for MPs'
156.article_body: Former Union Health Minister Harsh Vardhan was seen walking out of the oath-taking ceremony of Delhi's new Lieutenant Governor Vinai Kumar Saxena on Thursday. "They have not kept seats for members of Parliament even," he said on being questioned why he was leaving the event. "I will write to Vinai Kumar Saxena ji," he is heard saying in video.

157.title: Rahul could've taken more chances between 9th and 13th over: Shastri
157.article_body: Former India head coach Ravi Shastri said LSG captain KL Rahul could've taken more chances to score runs between the 9th and 13th over of their game against RCB on Wednesday. "[There] should have been someone who should have been targeted...when Deepak Hooda and Rahul were going," Shastri added. RCB restricted LSG to 193/6 and won by 14 runs.

158.title: Karan Johar cuts 5-tier cake on 50th birthday, video surfaces
158.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar cut a five-tier chocolate cake on his birthday on Wednesday. A video shared online showed Karan in front of the cake with several celebrities surrounding him during the party. Several pictures from Johar's party have surfaced online. Celebrities including Aamir Khan, Hrithik Roshan, Kareena Kapoor and Saif Ali Khan attended the party.

159.title: On-screen Jaya & I were fighting; we became friends on 'Rocky...' sets: Shabana
159.article_body: Actress Shabana Azmi said her equation changed with actress Jaya Bachchan on 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani' sets. "Jaya Bachchan and I have known one another for ages. But somehow we never got around to being friends," she added. "On-screen, we're supposed to be fighting constantly. Once the camera was switched off, we gradually became friends," Shabana said.

160.title: ED files chargesheet against K'taka Congress chief DK Shivakumar
160.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) filed a chargesheet against Karnataka Congress chief DK Shivakumar and others in a money laundering case on Thursday. The case pertains to a 2018 chargesheet filed by the Income Tax Department against Shivakumar and others for alleged tax evasion and hawala dealings. The ED had earlier arrested Shivakumar in September 2019.

161.title: Fortunately, Shiva Trilogy isn't being adapted into a movie: Author Amish
161.article_body: Author Amish Tripathi said "fortunately" his Shiva Trilogy is not being adapted into a movie, and instead being adapted into a series. "It has to be edited [if adapted into a movie]. That's a reality...You have the gift of time in [a] series," he added. "I am not too worried just because it's being adapted into a series," stated Amish.

162.title: WB minister Partha Chatterjee questioned by CBI for over 8 hrs in SSC case
162.article_body: West Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee was questioned for more than eight hours by the CBI in the alleged SSC recruitment irregularities on Wednesday. Chatterjee was questioned in three shifts at the CBI office in Kolkata, an official said. This was the second time since May 18 that the minister was questioned by the probe agency in connection with the case.

163.title: 19-yr-old youth hangs self in Zirakpur, female friend booked for abetment
163.article_body: A 19-year-old youth hanged himself from a ceiling fan at his house in Punjab's Zirakpur following which his female friend has been booked for abetment to suicide. Both of them studied at a private university in Kharar, an official said. The youth wanted to marry her but she had started seeing someone else, his father said in his complaint.

164.title: Canadian police ban PM Trudeau from event over safety concerns
164.article_body: Canadian police on Wednesday said they'd barred PM Justin Trudeau from a fundraising event over safety concerns after protesters started gathering outside the venue. Talking about the incident, Trudeau said attendees faced harassment, racist insults, and threats of violence. One of the protesters reportedly carried a model gallows and noose adorned with a slogan accusing Trudeau of treason.

165.title: Congress and NCP are our real enemies, not BJP: Sena's Vikas Gogawale
165.article_body: Shiv Sena (youth wing) leader Vikas Gogawale said that the Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) and Congress are the real enemies of the Sena and not the BJP. NCP and Congress take credit for the works done by Shiv Sena workers, he alleged. "Four former Congress corporators and a Shiv Sena corporator joined NCP last month," Gogawale further said.

166.title: I was nervous when defending 35 off 18: Harshal after win vs LSG
166.article_body: Talking about bowling the 18th over against LSG, RCB pacer Harshal Patel said he was nervous after LSG got six runs off two wides and needed 35 to win off 18 balls. "I realised the wide yorker wasn't coming through...[so], I followed the plan that worked in first two overs," he added. LSG scored two more runs in the over.

167.title: MP Police arrests 6 for damaging Jawaharlal Nehru's statue in Satna
167.article_body: Police arrested six people on Wednesday for their alleged involvement in damaging the statue of former Prime Minister Jawaharlal Nehru in Madhya Pradesh's Satna. A video of the alleged incident that went viral on social media showed some youths damaging the statue. Condemning the incident, former Chief Minister Kamal Nath tweeted, "I demand from the government to investigate the case."

168.title: Plane designed as flying museum in tribute to Maradona unveiled, pics surface
168.article_body: A plane designed as a flying museum in tribute to late football legend Diego Maradona was unveiled in Argentina's Buenos Aires on Wednesday. The Tango D10S, a 12-seater plane, has been financed by Argentine fintech company Give and Get. The plane will fly around Argentina and eventually to Qatar for the FIFA World Cup in November.

169.title: Why are you in politics, go home & cook: BJP leader to Supriya Sule; her husband reacts
169.article_body: Maharashtra BJP President Chandrakant Patil on Wednesday criticised NCP's Supriya Sule, saying, "Why are you even in politics, just go home and cook." Reacting to it, her husband Sadanand Sule said BJP is misogynistic, and added, "I'm proud of my wife who is a homemaker, mother and a successful politician, one amongst many other hardworking and talented women in India."

170.title: Daughter of teacher killed in US school attack posts tribute for her mother
170.article_body: The daughter of Eva Mireles, a teacher who was killed in mass shooting at a school in US' Texas, has posted tribute for her mother. "My sweet mommy, I'll miss you forever," Adalynn Ruiz wrote, addressing her mother as "the half that makes me whole". She called Mireles a "hero" who jumped in front of students to save them.

171.title: Can't think of more unlikely combination: Raghavan on Katrina, Sethupathi
171.article_body: Discussing his upcoming film 'Merry Christmas' which stars Katrina Kaif and Vijay Sethupathi, director Sriram Raghavan said, "I can't think of a more unlikely screen combination than this." Vijay stated Katrina is professional and very committed to her part. "It's lovely to work with her...Audiences will love the combination," he said. Vijay will be next seen in Kamal Haasan-starrer 'Vikram'.

172.title: This is very concerning: Musk on Twitter allegedly misusing user data
172.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk in response to Twitter paying $150 million in the US to settle claims of misusing user data, said, "If Twitter was not truthful here, what else is not true? This is very concerning news." Twitter allegedly used private data to target advertising for over six years after telling users it would be used for security reasons.
