173.title: 78% school students found online learning during pandemic 'burdensome': Survey
173.article_body: According to a survey conducted by the Ministry of Education, at least 78% school students found online learning during the pandemic "burdensome" and 24% of them did not have a digital device at home. The survey was conducted last year in November across India for classes 3, 5, 8 and 10 in which about 34 lakh students participated.

174.title: Won't cede control of Russia-occupied areas: Ukraine Prez Zelenskyy
174.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy dismissed suggestions that Ukraine should cede control of some areas occupied by Russian forces to reach a peace deal. Former US State Secretary Henry Kissinger this week had suggested Ukraine should let Russia keep Crimea, which it annexed in 2014. Reacting to it, Zelenskyy accused Kissinger of being like those who appeased the Nazis in 1938.

175.title: 2 BESCOM workers die, 1 seriously injured due to electric shock in K'taka
175.article_body: Two contract workers of Bangalore Electricity Supply Company Ltd (BESCOM) died and one was seriously injured after suffering an electric shock in Karnataka's Chintamani rural division on Wednesday. "Three workers were stringing an 11 kV cable line by replacing...old one...The cable accidentally came in contact with 66 kV line and caused a fatal accident," a senior BESCOM official said.

176.title: Kajol, Rani Mukerji & Ananya Panday attend Karan's 50th b'day; pics surface
176.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar turned a year older on May 25 as he celebrated his 50th birthday. His grand birthday party took place last evening in Mumbai and the theme was "black and bling". Several celebrities including Kajol Devgan, Rani Mukerji, Ananya Panday, Janhvi Kapoor, Sidharth Malhotra, Kiara Advani, Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Abhishek Bachchan among others attended the party.

177.title: 3 Sudanese nationals arrested with US dollars worth ₹12 cr in Mumbai
177.article_body: The Air Intelligence Unit (AIU) of Customs seized US dollars worth ₹12 crore from three Sudanese nationals in Mumbai, an official said on Wednesday. In the first case, two Sudanese passengers were arrested at the airport on Tuesday with US dollars worth around ₹5.6 crore. Whereas, a stash of US currency was seized from another Sudanese national in South Mumbai.

178.title: Russian hackers linked to new Brexit leak website: Google
178.article_body: Google has said that the 'English Coop' website which has published leaked emails from several leading supporters of Britain's exit from the EU is tied to Russian hackers. Richard Dearlove, who led Britain's MI6 between 1999-2004, confirmed being targeted by the hackers and said the leaked material should be treated with caution. Pro-Brexit historian Robert Tombs has also been targeted.

179.title: Out of 76, only 7 Marathwada towns in Maharashtra get water daily: Report
179.article_body: Out of 76 urban centres across eight districts in Maharashtra's Marathwada region, only seven receive water supply daily, according to a report by Aurangabad divisional commissioner's office. As per the report, the gap between two water supplies ranges from one to 15 days. The Jalna district's Badnapur town suffers the most as it receives water supply once in 15 days.

180.title: Akhilesh asks Maurya 'You take father's money to build roads?', UP CM says 'not right'
180.article_body: After Uttar Pradesh Deputy Chief Minister Keshav Prasad Maurya said it seems development in Uttar Pradesh has been done by selling Akhilesh Yadav's land in Saifai, the Samajwadi Party chief asked Maurya if he takes money from his father to build roads. Meanwhile, state Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath said it wasn't right for Yadav to use indecent words for Maurya.

181.title: Telangana CM to be not present in Hyderabad during PM Modi's visit
181.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao will not be present in Hyderabad during PM Narendra Modi's visit to the city on Thursday. KCR is scheduled to be in Bengaluru to meet former Prime Minister and Janata Dal (Secular) leader HD Devegowda. PM Modi is visiting Hyderabad to participate in the 20th-anniversary celebrations of the Indian School of Business.

182.title: Don't exempt defence services from RTI, veterans' body urges PM
182.article_body: The Indian Ex-Services League, an organisation of military veterans, has written a letter to PM Narendra Modi asking him not to let defence services be exempted from the purview of Right to Information (RTI) Act. Retired Brigadier Kartar Singh said RTI is a powerful tool for veterans, serving officers and their families to get service-related information and seek redressal.

183.title: 3 men cheat Odisha resident of ₹42 lakh on promise of doubling investment
183.article_body: Three men were arrested for cheating a resident of Odisha of ₹42.32 lakh on the promise of doubling his investment in 66 days. The complainant said accused persons told him that they are based in Chandigarh. The complainant transferred a total amount of ₹42.32 lakh in multiple transactions between August 2020 and February 2021.

184.title: NIA takes over investigation in Karnal IED seizure case
184.article_body: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) has taken over the investigation in the case pertaining to seizure of explosives in Haryana's Karnal on May 5. Notably, four terror suspects were arrested with three IEDs, 31 live cartridges and ₹1.3 lakh cash. The accused were reportedly in touch with a Pakistan-based man who asked them to deliver the explosives to Telangana.

185.title: 4 thalassemic children test HIV positive after blood transfusion in Maharashtra, 1 dies
185.article_body: Four thalassemic children tested positive for HIV in Maharashtra's Nagpur allegedly after blood transfusions and one of them died, ANI reported on Thursday. "Four children tested positive for HIV, out of them one died. Will take action against it," said Dr RK Dhakate, Assistant Deputy Director in Maharashtra Health Department.

186.title: He was relentless, messed up LSG's plan: Manjrekar on Patidar's 112* (54)
186.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Sanjay Manjrekar said RCB batter Rajat Patidar was "relentless" during his unbeaten 112 off 54 balls against LSG, at a strike rate of 207.40 in IPL 2022's Eliminator, adding he messed up the opposition's plan. "Not only did he play high-risk cricket and maintain a great strike rate, his batting ability was on display as well," stated Manjrekar.

187.title: RCB's Patidar, who slammed fastest hundred of IPL 2022, had gone unsold in mega auction
187.article_body: RCB's Rajat Patidar, who slammed the fastest hundred of IPL 2022 off 49 balls in Eliminator against LSG, had gone unsold in the mega auction. The 28-year-old Madhya Pradesh batter had a base price of ₹20 lakh, but couldn't find any takers. Patidar was signed by RCB as a replacement for the injured Luvnith Sisodia in early April.

188.title: My execution went fine against Krunal, then I got confident: Patidar
188.article_body: Talking about his unbeaten century against LSG, RCB batter Rajat Patidar said he got confident after smashing 19 runs off Krunal Pandya during the sixth over. "The last over of the powerplay when Krunal was bowling to me, my execution went fine...I got confident afterwards. The wicket was pretty good," he stated. Patidar scored 112* off 54 in the match.

189.title: Sanitation workers in Mathura go on strike over salary, uniform
189.article_body: Safai Karamcharis or sanitation workers in UP's Mathura launched a strike on Wednesday raising various demands including better salaries and uniforms. "We will not budge until our 11-point demands are met," said a protester. He claimed that while workers in other municipalities get 30-day wages, those in Mathura Municipal Corporation only get paid for 26 days.

190.title: Odisha man tied to truck, garlanded with shoes for stealing phone; 2 arrested
190.article_body: A man near Odisha's Bhutamundai was tied in front of a truck and garlanded with shoes for allegedly stealing a mobile phone, police said. They have arrested the truck driver and his helper over the matter. The incident took place on May 19 after the truck driver allegedly caught the man stealing a mobile phone and decided to punish him.

191.title: 21-year-old actress Bidisha found hanging at her flat in Kolkata
191.article_body: Model-turned-actress Bidisha De Majumdar was found hanging at her flat in Kolkata's Nagerbazar area on Wednesday. The 21-year-old actress had been living in the rented apartment for the past four months. Police said a probe has been initiated to identify whether it is murder or suicide. A note was reportedly found at the flat.

192.title: Which cities have the most overworked populations globally?
192.article_body: Dubai is the most overworked city globally, according to a study released by mobile access technology company Kisi. It is followed by Hong Kong, Kuala Lumpur, Singapore, Montevideo, Tokyo, Bangkok, Cape Town, Lisbon and Budapest. Kisi analysed data from Eurostat and the US Bureau of Labor Statistics.

193.title: Vinai Kumar Saxena takes oath as 22nd Lieutenant Governor of Delhi
193.article_body: Vinai Kumar Saxena on Thursday took oath as the 22nd Lieutenant Governor of Delhi at a ceremony at the Raj Niwas in the national capital. Saxena was administered the oath by the Acting Chief Justice of the Delhi High Court, Vipin Sanghi. Rashtrapati Bhavan on May 23 announced that President Ram Nath Kovind has appointed Saxena as Delhi's new LG.

194.title: We bought Anil's 'Mr India' jacket from Chor Bazaar, he still has it: Shekhar
194.article_body: Shekhar Kapur, director of 'Mr India', said that the jacket that actor Anil Kapoor wore in the film was hard to find and was bought from Chor Bazaar. "Throughout the film, he wore one cap, trousers and jacket. There were no duplicate clothes. He actually wore only one set of clothes throughout...Anil still has the jacket," he added.

195.title: He did what Samson couldn't: Hayden on Rajat Patidar's 112* (54) vs LSG
195.article_body: Discussing RCB batter Rajat Patidar's 112* off 54 balls at a strike rate of 207.40 against LSG in IPL 2022's Eliminator, Matthew Hayden said Patidar did what RR's Sanju Samson couldn't, in the Qualifier 1 against GT. "It was his night...Simply superb innings," added Hayden. Samson scored 47 off 26 balls in RR's defeat against GT by seven wickets.

196.title: Centre, Bengal govt fooling farmers on MSP: Yogendra Yadav
196.article_body: Jai Kisan Andolan leader Yogendra Yadav criticised the Centre for making law on minimum support price (MSP) by saying that the Centre is "fooling farmers". Yadav also criticised West Bengal government for "not implementing MSP regime for crops". "This time, the protests will not just be in Delhi but in every state capital, district headquarters and block office," he added.

197.title: CM Kejriwal directs all Delhi govt sports facilities to stay open for athletes till 10 pm
197.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal has directed all the government sports facilities to stay open for athletes till 10 pm. This comes after coaches and athletes claimed that they were being asked to empty the Thyagraj Stadium by 7 pm so that an IAS officer could walk his dog there. However, the IAS officer had denied the allegations.

198.title: Bacteria with natural antibiotic resistance found in Antarctica: Study
198.article_body: Scientists have found bacteria in Antarctica that have genes that give them natural antibiotic and antimicrobial resistance and have the potential to spread out of the polar regions. University of Chile researcher Andres Marcoleta said these abilities, which evolved to resist extreme conditions, are contained in mobile DNA fragments that can easily be transferred to other bacteria.

199.title: Prostitution racket busted in Delhi, 4 including 3 women arrested
199.article_body: The Delhi Police on Tuesday busted a prostitution racket in Rohini's Sanjay Nagar and arrested four persons including three women. Based on a complaint, the police deployed a decoy customer to the area where two of the accused accepted ₹1,000 each in exchange for services. On confirmation of the racket, police raided the location and arrested the accused persons.

200.title: Twitter to pay $150 mn in US for allegedly misusing users' data
200.article_body: Twitter has agreed to pay $150 million in the US to settle claims that it misused users' private data to target advertising after telling them the information would be used for security reasons. The allegations state that between May 2013 and September 2019, Twitter used personal information to target users with ads. The practice affected over 140 million Twitter users.

201.title: Businessman found murdered in bathroom with his hands tied in B'luru
201.article_body: A 74-year-old businessman was found murdered inside the bathroom of his flat in Bengaluru's Chamarajpet with his hands tied and mouth covered with a piece of cloth. The murder came to light after victim Jugraj Jain's grandson came to check on him on Wednesday as he wasn't attending calls. Jain's domestic help Bijaram is suspected to have killed him.

202.title: Which are the best cities globally for work-life balance in 2022 according to a study?
202.article_body: According to a study released by mobile access technology company Kisi, the best city globally for work-life balance in 2022 is Oslo. It is followed by Bern, Helsinki, Zurich, Copenhagen, Geneva, Ottawa, Sydney, Stuttgart and Munich. The data for the study was sourced from international organisations, NGO reports, open access datasets, public surveys and crowdsourcing platforms.

203.title: 3 more people die during Kedarnath Dham Yatra, 37 killed so far
203.article_body: Three more people have died of heart attacks during the Kedarnath Dham Yatra, Rudraprayag District Administration confirmed on Wednesday. With this, the cumulative death toll of the Kedarnath Yatra has reached 37 since the opening of the shrine's doors for devotees on May 6. Overall, 57 deaths were recorded until Sunday during Char Dham Yatra in Uttarakhand since May 3.

204.title: 2 people came to call her for shoot, shot her when she refused: TV artiste Amreen's father
204.article_body: Khazir Mohd Bhat, father of J&K TV artiste Amreen Bhat who was killed by terrorists in Budgam, said that two people came to their home to call her for a shoot last night. "They shot her after she told them that she would not go for the shoot," Bhat said. He added that she was like a son to him.

205.title: I had two months of no cricket before IPL, made me really fresh: Buttler
205.article_body: Opening up on his form in the ongoing IPL season, RR opener Jos Buttler said not playing any T20 cricket since the T20 World Cup last year made him fresh for the tournament. "I had two months of no cricket. It was actually good for me," he added. Currently, Buttler is the highest run-getter of IPL 2022 with 718 runs.

206.title: Delhi Police arrest man for stealing laptops from tourist buses
206.article_body: The Delhi Police have arrested a 35-year-old man for stealing laptops from tourist buses. Police said the man used to travel in inter-state tourist buses and would take a seat at the back to observe people. He would find a suitable target and steal the laptops when the passengers were sleeping. He would get off the bus to avoid suspicion.

207.title: Media executive loses ₹50,000 to email fraud in Mumbai
207.article_body: A 24-year-old Mumbai-based media professional was cheated of nearly ₹50,000 by a fraudster who sent her emails from a fake ID using her senior's name. The victim was asked to pay the amount on an urgent basis, the police said. The woman first transferred ₹25,000 and then another ₹24,700 online in the bank account mentioned in email, the police informed.

208.title: CBI raids ex-J'khand minister Bandhu Tirkey's residences over National Games scam
208.article_body: CBI on Thursday conducted raids at Ranchi residences of former Jharkhand minister and Congress leader Bandhu Tirkey in connection with the 34th National Games scam. He was the sports minister when the tender process for the games started and was allocated. Tirkey was disqualified as a member of the Legislative Assembly in April after being convicted in a DA case.

209.title: Kiss between Pratik & Ranveer Brar was deliberately awkward: Hansal Mehta
209.article_body: Speaking about Ranveer Brar and Pratik Gandhi's awkward kiss in 'Modern Love', filmmaker Hansal Mehta said the awkwardness was always intended in the scene. "The character of Manzu comes from years of repression. He's not going to...start kissing like Dean Martin," he added. "Some people...messaged me asking, 'Why are they...awkward?' I said, 'I'm glad you see it's awkward'," Hansal said.

210.title: Aamir, Salman attend Karan Johar's 50th b'day party; pics surface
210.article_body: Actors Aamir Khan and Salman Khan were among the celebrities who attended filmmaker Karan Johar's 50th birthday party, with Aamir seen alongside his ex-wife and director-producer Kiran Rao. Aamir wore a blue t-shirt with a black jacket and denims. Kiran wore a silver blingy mini dress paired with boots. Salman opted for a leather jacket with washed blue jeans.

211.title: 11 newborn babies killed in hospital fire in Senegal
211.article_body: As many as 11 newborn babies were killed after a fire broke out in the neonatology department of a hospital in Senegal's Tivaouane. President Macky Sall, who is on a state visit to Angola, took to Twitter to express his "deepest sympathy" to the bereaved families. Senegal's Health Minister said that preliminary investigation showed a short circuit triggered the fire.

212.title: Athletes asked to empty Delhi stadium so that IAS officer can walk his dog, claims coach
212.article_body: Athletes and coaches at Delhi government-run Thyagraj Stadium complained about being forced to wrap training by 7 pm and empty stadium so that Delhi’s Principal Secretary (Revenue) Sanjeev Khirwar can walk his dog. "We used to train till 8-8.30 pm...earlier...Now, our training...routine has been disrupted," a coach said. Khirwar, a 1994-batch IAS officer, described the allegation as "incorrect".

213.title: These are tough times, tough calls have to be taken: Vedantu CEO
213.article_body: Vedantu CEO Vamsi Krishna in an interview discussing layoffs at the startup and "funding winter" for the startup ecosystem, said, "These are tough times, tough calls have to be taken." Vedantu recently laid off 624 employees. "In 2015, we [startups] had...huge funding spree...And then in 2016, the terms were eerily similar to...current environment. It was a funding winter," he added.

214.title: Samajwadi Party names RLD chief Jayant Chaudhary for Rajya Sabha polls
214.article_body: Akhilesh Yadav's Samajwadi Party (SP) on Thursday named Rashtriya Lok Dal (RLD) chief Jayant Chaudhary for Rajya Sabha polls as its third candidate. "Jayant Chaudhary will be the joint candidate of Rajya Sabha from SP and RLD," SP tweeted. This comes after Kapil Sibal, who quit Congress, filed the nomination for Rajya Sabha on Wednesday with SP's support.

215.title: Kolkata airport officials told to look out for flyers with monkeypox symptoms
215.article_body: With several countries reporting confirmed or suspected cases of monkeypox, officials at the Kolkata airport have been told to look out for travellers with the symptoms of the disease. "Any sick passenger with a travel history to monkeypox-affected countries will have to be isolated and samples will be sent for testing in labs in Pune," a health department official said.

216.title: Death toll due to Assam floods, landslides rises to 27: ASDMA
216.article_body: Amid heavy rains in Assam, the death toll due to floods and landslides has risen to 27, the Assam State Disaster Management Authority (ASDMA) said. Of the total casualties, 21 have been killed in floods and the remaining lost their lives in landslides. More than 5.8 lakh people in 18 different districts are still affected as of Wednesday, officials added.

217.title: When people see a woman riding bike, they become irritated: Fatima Shaikh
217.article_body: Actress Fatima Shaikh is currently shooting for Dhak Dhak, a road trip film on the journey of four women on bikes. When asked about women riding bikes, Fatima said, "When people see a woman riding a bike, they become irritated. They follow you...try to race with you." "I was in...mask so they didn’t know who I was," she added.

218.title: Have been really bad incidents: Northeastern actress Andrea on discrimination
218.article_body: Actress Andrea Kevichusa who is from Nagaland, and will be seen in the upcoming Ayushmann Khurrana-starrer 'Anek', said she has experienced "really bad" instances of discrimination, adding she is habituated to hearing racial slurs like "chinki" and "Chinese". Andrea stated that she was once asked by a make-up artist about when she will be returning to her country.

219.title: I haven't seen many better innings than the one Patidar played: Kohli
219.article_body: Praising Rajat Patidar for his unbeaten 112-run innings against LSG, Virat Kohli said, "I have seen many impact innings...[but] I have not seen many better innings than the one he played." Kohli added, "What Patidar did was very, very special and I don't think anyone should take that for granted." RCB will now face RR in Qualifier 2 on Friday.

220.title: Ukraine Prez orders end to visa-free travel for Russians amid war
220.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has ordered an end to visa-free travel for Russian citizens to Ukraine, citing the need to improve border security amid the ongoing invasion by Russian troops. This comes after a citizen submitted a petition asking for this practice to end. Last month, Russia imposed visa restrictions for citizens of nations that Moscow deems "unfriendly", including Ukraine.

221.title: US laws too loose, India too needs review: Chidambaram on Texas shooting
221.article_body: Congress leader P Chidambaram on Thursday condemned the shooting at a school in US' Texas that claimed the lives of 21 people, including 19 students. He said that the American laws are too "loose" on gun control. "India too needs to review and tighten laws relating to acquisition and possession of firearms," Chidambaram tweeted.

222.title: Notice issued to Supertech after 2 kids fall from 9th floor of high-rise
222.article_body: The Greater Noida Authority has issued a notice to Supertech after two children fell from a shaft on the ninth floor of a building at Supertech Ecovillage-2. "The shaft...was given aluminium doors, which had acrylic seats instead of panels, which is not enough in terms of safety," an official said. The authority has sought a reply in three days.

223.title: Jack Dorsey steps down from Twitter board
223.article_body: Jack Dorsey has stepped down from the Twitter board of directors. Dorsey quit as Twitter CEO in November last year, handing over the post to Indian-origin Parag Agrawal who was then the CTO of the company. At the time, Twitter said that Dorsey would stay on the board "until his term expires at the 2022 meeting of stockholders".

224.title: Allahabad HC denies bail to 34 policemen accused of killing 10 Sikhs in 1991
224.article_body: Allahabad High Court denied bail to 34 policemen accused of killing 10 Sikhs in an alleged fake encounter in 1991. Accused had indulged in a "barbaric and inhuman" killing of innocent persons by calling them "terrorists", HC added. The victims were brought down from a bus by a UP Police team in Pilibhit and were later killed by the accused.

225.title: Series of blasts in Afghanistan leaves at least 14 dead
225.article_body: At least 14 people were reportedly killed in a series of blasts in Afghanistan on Wednesday. One explosion took place inside the Hazrat Zakaria Mosque in Kabul in which five people were killed and several injured, according to the Taliban. In another three bombings, minivans in the northern city of Mazar-e-Sharif were struck, killing nine people, said a Taliban spokesperson.

226.title: India's interests no different from EU's: India on importing Russian oil in ruble
226.article_body: On being asked whether India would pay in ruble for Russian oil at the World Economic Forum in Davos, Union Minister Piyush Goyal said every country has to look after its national interest. He added that India's interests are no different from the European Union's. He said any suggestion that India was contributing to the Ukraine situation doesn't stand scrutiny.

227.title: PC George arrested, sent to 14-day custody in alleged hate speech case
227.article_body: Former MLA and senior Kerala politician, PC George, has been sent to 14-day judicial custody in an alleged hate speech case on Thursday. He was arrested on Wednesday for allegedly making hate speech against Muslims at Ananthapuri Hindu Maha Sammelan in Thiruvananthapuram on April 30. "I haven't done anything illegal. I've respect for...law, that's why I am cooperating," George said.

228.title: Infosys CEO Salil Parekh gets 88% pay hike, salary jumps to ₹79.75 crore per annum
228.article_body: Software major Infosys CEO Salil Parekh’s salary has been revised upwards by 88% to ₹79.75 crore per annum. The salary announcement comes days after Infosys reappointed Salil Parekh as MD and CEO for five more years. The company said it considered factors such as total shareholder return, rise in market cap and growth while recommending change in remuneration.

229.title: Faced pain where it was impossible to breathe: Bhagyashree on sabbatical
229.article_body: Discussing the reason behind her sabbatical from showbiz, actress Bhagyashree said she developed a pain in her shoulder while working on a TV show 'Laut Aao Trisha' which aired between 2014-15. "I didn't bother to get it treated. That caused a major problem...One night, I got up to pain where it was impossible for me to breathe," added Bhagyashree.

230.title: Most bogus case against me: Karti Chidambaram on 'visa for Chinese' case
230.article_body: Congress MP Karti P Chidambaram, accused of facilitating visas for Chinese nationals by flouting rules, said that every case that has been filed against him is a "bogus case". "One is bogus... another is more bogus. This one [the 'visa for Chinese' case] is most bogus," he added. The Congress leader is also accused in INX media case.

231.title: Announce polls in 6 days or I'll return to Islamabad for protest: Imran Khan to Pak govt
231.article_body: Former Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan gave six-day ultimatum to the country's government to dissolve assemblies and announce elections. He called the government "imported" and said that he will return to Islamabad for protest after six days. Khan started his march from Khyber Pakhtunkhwa with a large caravan to demand the removal of the government and an immediate national election.

232.title: Andreessen Horowitz raises record $4.5 billion crypto fund
232.article_body: Silicon Valley venture capital firm Andreessen Horowitz has raised $4.5 billion for its fourth cryptocurrency fund, the industry's largest to date. Around $1.5 billion from the fund will be used to invest in seed rounds of startups and $3 billion for venture investments. The firm unveiled a $2.2 billion fund to invest in crypto networks in June last year.

233.title: Monkeypox not as contagious as COVID, but matter of concern: NTAGI
233.article_body: Monkeypox is not as contagious or severe as COVID-19, but its spread is a matter of concern, said National Technical Advisory Group on Immunisation (NTAGI) chief Dr NK Arora. He added that the disease will have more severe outcomes in those who are immunocompromised. He further said that the government has set up an expert committee on monkeypox.

234.title: Pune Police mention cyber fraudsters' 'procedures', share tip for safety
234.article_body: Pune Police took to Twitter to share "new criminal procedures" of cyber fraudsters, saying that fraudsters put mobile number on photos of Google Maps listing of popular stores and claim to provide very fast home delivery. The tweet added that fraudsters share QR code for payment. Sharing a tip, the police asked the public to check the number on Truecaller.

235.title: Police should treat sex workers with dignity, not abuse them: SC
235.article_body: Sex workers and their children enjoy all basic human rights and other rights guaranteed in the Constitution to all citizens, the Supreme Court observed. "Police (in all states and UTs) should treat all sex workers with dignity and should not abuse them, both verbally and physically, subject them to violence or coerce them into any sexual activity," the bench stated.

236.title: US, Japan stage joint fighter jet flight after N Korea missile launches
236.article_body: The US and Japan said they flew fighter jets together over the Sea of Japan after North Korea fired missiles into the waters that separate Japan and Korean peninsula on Wednesday. The exercise was meant to "showcase combined capabilities to deter...regional threats", US said. North Korea fired missiles hours after US President Joe Biden left the region following a trip.

237.title: Nadal becomes 3rd man in tennis history to win 300 Grand Slam singles matches
237.article_body: World number five Rafael Nadal defeated Corentin Moutet in the second round of the ongoing French Open to become the third man in tennis history to record 300 Grand Slam match wins. Nadal is behind Roger Federer's 369 wins and Novak Djokovic's 324. Nadal will now take on Dutchman Botic van de Zandschulp in the third round on Friday.

238.title: In a first, 12-year-old boy celebrates birthday in Noida Metro coach
238.article_body: A 12-year-old Noida-based boy, Swayam Saksham, became the first person to hold a birthday party on an Aqua Line coach. The celebration was attended by 15 of Swayam's friends, along with 10 relatives. With its 'Celebrations on Wheels' initiative, Noida Metro Rail Corporation (NMRC) in 2020 announced a facility for people to book individual metro coaches for private celebrations.

239.title: Delhi to give incentive of up to ₹5,500 to 10,000 buyers of e-cycles
239.article_body: Delhi government announced the first 10,000 e-cycle buyers will get a purchase incentive of 25% with a cap of a maximum of ₹5,500 per unit. An additional incentive of ₹2,000 will be given to the first 1,000 buyers, it added. Cargo e-cycles will be eligible for an incentive of 33% of the selling price up to ₹1,500, Delhi government stated.

240.title: Punjab woman given triple talaq over dowry; husband, 3 others booked
240.article_body: Police have booked the husband of a woman from Ludhiana along with his parents and matchmaker for allegedly giving triple talaq to his wife last year. "The groom's family demanded...car from us as dowry," the woman's father claimed. "When we were unable to arrange the car, [the matchmaker] handed my daughter a...paper with...'talaq' written on it thrice," he alleged.

241.title: 3 LeT terrorists killed in encounter in J&K's Kupwara
241.article_body: Three terrorists affiliated with the terror outfit Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) were shot dead in an encounter that broke out in Jammu and Kashmir's Kupwara on Thursday morning, Kashmir Zone Police said. Police launched the operation based on a specific input and foiled the infiltration attempt by terrorists. Incriminating materials, including arms and ammunition, were also recovered, police said.

242.title: Will get big opportunity: Yediyurappa after son denied MLC ticket
242.article_body: Former Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa has said he is confident that BJP will give his son BY Vijayendra a big opportunity in the future. The statement comes a day after Vijayendra was not named in candidate list for MLC polls. "The party will not forsake those who are capable and loyal," said Yediyurappa. The party will create opportunities, he added.

243.title: Boeing's Starliner capsule returns from ISS in key test mission
243.article_body: Boeing's Starliner capsule successfully returned to Earth from the International Space Station and landed in New Mexico on Wednesday, completing a key test flight. The test was to show if the spacecraft is capable of carrying humans to the International Space Station. The firm's previous two attempts to carry out the mission had ended in failure.

244.title: ED raids 7 locations in Mumbai & Pune linked to Maharashtra minister Anil Parab
244.article_body: Enforcement Directorate conducted raids at locations linked to Maharashtra Transport Minister and Shiv Sena leader Anil Parab in connection with alleged irregularities in land deal in coastal Dapoli area of Ratnagiri and other charges. Raids were conducted at seven locations in Pune and Mumbai after fresh case under criminal sections of Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA) was filed.

245.title: Infinity Learn announces the acquisition of Wizklub for $10 million
245.article_body: Sri Chaitanya-backed Edtech startup Infinity Learn announced that it has acquired Wizklub, a startup that builds skills for children aged 6-14 with High Order Thinking Skills (HOTS) & SmarTech programs, for $10 million. Named 'Infinity Futurz', this vertical aims to help children develop active learning, critical thinking, innovation, & the ability to use technology to solve real-world problems.

246.title: Devendra Fadnavis' wife Amruta walks Cannes red carpet, shares pics
246.article_body: Former Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis' wife, banker Amruta Fadnavis walked the red carpet at the Cannes Film Festival. Sharing pictures on Instagram, she wrote, "Walked the [red carpet]...to raise awareness about food, health and sustainability." Amruta was accompanied by First Lady of Ivory Coast Dominique Ouattara, Lebanese-Jordanian Princess Ghida Talal and actor Stone among others.

247.title: India reports 2,628 new COVID-19 cases, 18 deaths in last 24 hours
247.article_body: India has reported 2,628 COVID-19 cases, 2,167 recoveries and 18 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 2,124 COVID-19 cases and 17 deaths. Active cases in India stand at 15,414, while the death toll has risen to 5,24,525.

248.title: What did court tell Yasin Malik when he claimed to be Mahatma Gandhi's follower?
248.article_body: Yasin Malik told NIA court he gave up violence in 1994 and declared he would follow Mahatma Gandhi's peaceful path. The court said Malik cannot claim to be Gandhi's follower. The court added that Gandhi called off entire non-cooperation movement after Chauri Chaura violence but Malik neither condemned violence nor withdrew his calendar of protest which led to the violence.

249.title: Messages sent by 18-year-old minutes before killing 19 kids at US school revealed
249.article_body: The 18-year-old Texas gunman who killed 19 children and two teachers sent messages on Facebook minutes before he attacked, Texas Governor Greg Abbott said on Wednesday. The gunman first sent a message saying, "I'm going to shoot my grandmother." "I've shot my grandmother," he wrote in the second message. He then messaged, "I'm going to shoot an elementary school."

250.title: AIADMK 'weak opposition', people expect me to lead: Sasikala
250.article_body: VK Sasikala, aide of former Tamil Nadu CM J Jayalalithaa, on Wednesday described the AIADMK under present leadership as a "weak opposition". "It's been a year since they came to power and they have been fighting with the union government. They need to implement and execute projects," she stated. Sasikala added that people are expecting her to lead the party.

251.title: Verdict delivered, not justice: Gupkar alliance on life sentence to Yasin Malik
251.article_body: People's Alliance for Gupkar Declaration (PAGD) said that the life sentence to J&K separatist leader Yasin Malik in a terror funding case is "unfortunate". PAGD added that the NIA court has "delivered verdict but not justice". "We are afraid that this will further compound the uncertainties in the region and will only fuel more alienation and separatist feelings," PAGD stated.

252.title: Can expect new film starring Dhanush's character in lead soon: Russo Brothers
252.article_body: After trailer launch of 'The Gray Man', Joe and Anthony Russo said that fans can expect a new film starring actor Dhanush's character in lead soon. While talking about his character, they said, "He plays one of the...top assassins [in] the world and has two major fight blocks in the film...Dhanush has...great camera presence and we loved seeing him perform."

253.title: 'Evidence too sketchy': HC grants PDP leader bail in terror case
253.article_body: PDP leader Waheed Para was granted bail in a terror conspiracy case by the High Court of Jammu & Kashmir and Ladakh on Wednesday. "The evidence as is gathered by the prosecution is too sketchy to be believed prima facie true," said the court. The bench cited the Supreme Court's recent ruling on sedition while granting the relief.

254.title: Musk pledges $6.25 billion more in equity to fund Twitter deal
254.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has pledged an additional $6.25 billion in equity financing to fund the $44-billion offer for Twitter. He is also in talks with Twitter Co-founder Jack Dorsey and others to help finance the deal. Shares of Twitter rose more than 5% hours after the news of Musk's commitment broke, while Tesla shares dipped about 1%.

255.title: Bypolls to 3 Lok Sabha, 7 Assembly seats across 6 states on June 23: EC
255.article_body: Bypolls to three Lok Sabha seats and seven Assembly seats across six states will be held on June 23, the Election Commission said on Wednesday. The three Lok Sabha seats are Uttar Pradesh's Azamgarh and Rampur and Punjab's Sangrur. The seven Assembly seats are Delhi's Rajinder Nagar, Jharkhand's Mandar, Andhra Pradesh's Atmakur, Tripura's Agartala, Town Bordowali, Surma and Jubarajnagar.

256.title: I'm his huge fan, I'm not planning to dethrone him: Siddhant on Varun Dhawan
256.article_body: When asked if he plans to dethrone actor Varun Dhawan, actor Siddhant Chaturvedi said, "I'm his huge fan. It's nothing that I'm planning to dethrone him. I've...few fans and he has a huge fan following, so we can go in for some barter." "I think it's not a fight of fans, it's a fight for good content," he added.

257.title: It was a special day, guys put in a special performance: Du Plessis on win vs LSG
257.article_body: RCB captain Faf Du Plessis said it was a "special day" as they defeated LSG in the IPL 2022 Eliminator. Praising batter Rajat Patidar for his unbeaten 112-run innings, Plessis said, "His hundred was one of the best I've seen in the IPL." He added, "We were very happy as a group...We didn't feel like it was a big game."

258.title: Pedestrian stoned to death by 2 motorcycle-borne youths in Pune
258.article_body: A 30-year-old pedestrian in Pune was allegedly stoned to death by two youths on Hadapsar-Mundhwa road on Tuesday. According to police, the accused were riding a two-wheeler which hit the pedestrian from behind. Following this, the deceased and accused reportedly engaged in a verbal fight and one of the accused took a stone and hit the victim on the head.

259.title: Work ethics in B'wood still slipshod, totally different in South: Dalip
259.article_body: Actor Dalip Tahil said the work ethics in Bollywood are still "slipshod", adding it's totally different in the South Indian film industry. "Scripts are not ready in time, the availability, changing schedules...they are all a part and parcel of films," stated Dalip. "From my experience of working in South Indian films, it is a far better oiled machinery," he said.

260.title: Mumbai-Navi Mumbai water taxi service to halt at Gateway of India after monsoon
260.article_body: The water taxi services between Mumbai and Navi Mumbai, which started in February this year, will have a stoppage at the Gateway of India after monsoon, officials said. Currently, the Mumbai-Navi Mumbai water taxi service operates between Domestic Cruise Terminal (DCT) at Ferry Wharf in Mazgaon and Belapur jetty. This step is taken to attract higher footfall, an official said.

261.title: BMC issues danger alert to slums in Mumbai's landslide-prone areas
261.article_body: Ahead of the monsoon, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) issued a danger alert to residents of the slums in Mumbai's S ward area and asked them to move to a safer place. In case of any accident or loss of life or property due to natural calamity, the BMC will not be responsible for it, a civic notice said.

262.title: Mumbai records 295 new COVID-19 cases, highest in 3 months
262.article_body: Mumbai on Wednesday recorded 295 new COVID-19 infections, the highest in the last three months. Of the 295 new patients, 12 are admitted to hospitals, according to data by Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC). With 1,531 active cases, Mumbai's test positivity rate (TPR) stood at 3.2%. However, no new death was reported due to the virus on Wednesday, data showed.

263.title: Twitter investors vote against re-electing Musk-backer Durban to board
263.article_body: Twitter investors on Wednesday voted against re-electing co-head of private equity firm Silver Lake Egon Durban, who has been a backer of Tesla CEO Elon Musk's firms, to the board at an annual meeting. They re-elected Patrick Pichette, a general partner at Inovia Capital, to the board. The shareholders also voted against annual elections for directors, or declassifying the board.

264.title: Hyd woman cheated of ₹10 lakh on pretext of getting medical seat, 1 held
264.article_body: Hyderabad Police arrested a man for cheating a woman of ₹10.16 lakh on the pretext of providing her medical seat at KIMS in Bengaluru. The accused was arrested in Bihar and has been brought to Hyderabad on a transit warrant, police added. "After receiving the money, the accused switched off his mobile phone and cheated her," police further said.

265.title: Yasin Malik's crimes meant to strike at the heart of the idea of India: NIA court
265.article_body: An NIA court in Delhi which handed life term to Kashmiri separatist Yasin Malik in a case related to terrorism and secessionist activities said that his crimes "intended to strike at the heart of the idea of India". "The crime becomes more serious as it was committed with the assistance of foreign powers and designated terrorists," the court added.

266.title: Karnataka reports 208 new COVID-19 cases; 197 in Bengaluru alone
266.article_body: Karnataka on Wednesday recorded 208 new COVID-19 cases and zero coronavirus-related deaths. Of the total cases, 197 infections were reported from Bengaluru alone. The city also reported 118 recoveries the same day. The number of active cases in Bengaluru now stands at 1,730 with a positivity rate of 1.13%, according to data published by Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP).

267.title: Stray dogs in Delhi a neglected lot, must look after them: HC
267.article_body: The Delhi High Court on Wednesday said that stray dogs in the national capital are a neglected lot and that it is necessary to look after them. Hearing a plea seeking regular supply of vaccines for stray dogs against diseases like canine distemper and parvovirus, the court asked the Delhi government to respond within six weeks.

268.title: Suryakumar Yadav clarifies his 'amazing attitude' tweet for Parag after facing criticism
268.article_body: Cricketer Suryakumar Yadav clarified his 'amazing attitude on the field' tweet for RR batting all-rounder Riyan Parag after several fans criticised him for his tweet. Fans criticised Suryakumar citing Parag getting angry on the field on couple of occasions during RR's Qualifier 1 match against GT. Suryakumar clarified that the tweet was for his fielding and asked fans to "chill".

269.title: Sidhu put on paper work in Patiala jail, would help maintain records: Official
269.article_body: After being sent to jail for a year in connection with road rage case of 1988, Navjot Singh Sidhu has been put on "paper work", an official said. The official also mentioned that Sidhu will be assisting in maintaining jail records while doing a clerical job. Reports said a board of doctors has recommended a seven-meal diet for Sidhu.

270.title: It's obvious, we let ourselves down in the field: Rahul on defeat vs RCB
270.article_body: After their 14-run defeat against RCB in the IPL 2022 Eliminator, LSG captain KL Rahul said their fielding let them down in the match. "It's quite obvious, the reasons why we didn't win. We let ourselves down in the field. Dropping easy catches never helps," Rahul stated. "It's a new franchise...Have to try and come back stronger," he added.

271.title: Pistol found in student's car near US school a day after 18-yr-old killed 19 kids
271.article_body: Police in US' Texas have arrested a school student after a pistol and a replica rifle were found in his car that was parked near the campus. "The juvenile suspect was charged with Unlawful Carrying Weapons in a Weapon-Free School Zone," police said. This comes a day after an 18-year-old killed 19 kids at an elementary school in Texas.

272.title: Apple to raise hourly workers' starting pay in US to at least $22: WSJ
272.article_body: Apple has informed its employees that it will be increasing the starting pay for hourly workers to a minimum of $22 per hour, and higher in certain markets, the Wall Street Journal reported. The new starting wage represents a 45% increase compared to 2018. Starting salaries in the US are also expected to increase.

273.title: 2 charred to death as van overturns and catches fire in Ghaziabad
273.article_body: A man and woman were charred to death and four others were injured as the van they were travelling in overturned and caught fire on Delhi-Meerut Expressway in Ghaziabad, police said. "Prima facie...driver tried to avoid ramming into a scooty...its CNG cylinder caught fire," police added. All victims are residents of Haridwar and are related to each other, police stated.

274.title: Man impersonates Delhi Police official to impress girlfriend, arrested
274.article_body: A 27-year-old man was arrested by police near Noida Sector-15's Sangam Hotel for allegedly impersonating a Delhi Police personnel to impress his girlfriend. The accused, Rahul Sharma, donned an assistant sub-inspector's uniform and was loitering in the area for over two hours, which made on-duty police officials suspicious. Police recovered two pairs of uniforms and two badges from Sharma.

275.title: Travel in bus once a week, submit feedback: Delhi govt to officials
275.article_body: The Delhi government on Wednesday directed all group A and B officers of the Transport Department and the Delhi Transport Corporation to travel by bus at least once a week and submit feedback on their experience. "There is no way to constantly improve than from the feedback we give ourselves," said Transport Minister Kailash Gahlot while tweeting about the order.

276.title: RCB knock LSG out of IPL 2022, to face RR for place in final
276.article_body: Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) defeated Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) by 14 runs in IPL 2022 Eliminator. The match witnessed RCB batter Rajat Patidar slam IPL 2022's fastest hundred off 49 deliveries. RCB will now face Rajasthan Royals (RR) in the Qualifier 2 on Friday. The winner of the Qualifier 2 will face Gujarat Titans (GT) in the final on Sunday.

277.title: Govt on course to privatise two public sector banks: Report
277.article_body: The government is committed to the privatisation of two public sector banks (PSBs) and will take the steps required in the coming months, PTI reported. As per its sources, Central Bank of India and Indian Overseas Bank are the likely candidates for privatisation. The government had announced its intent to take up the privatisation of two PSBs in Budget 2021-22.

278.title: Indigo's net loss widens to ₹1,681.8 crore in Q4, income rises 29%
278.article_body: India's biggest airline Indigo on Wednesday reported a net loss of ₹1,681.8 crore in the quarter ending March 31, 2022. This year's Q4 loss was 46.6% more than the loss incurred by the airline in the corresponding period a year ago. Meanwhile, its total income for the quarter jumped 29% y-o-y to ₹8,207.5 crore from ₹6,361.8 crore in Q4 FY21.

279.title: Power Ministry seeks 2-yr extension to emissions deadline: Report
279.article_body: The Power Ministry has sought a two-year extension for the installation of emission-cutting equipment in thermal power plants, Reuters reported. The government initially had set a 2017 deadline but later changed it to varying deadlines for different regions, ending in 2022. Thermal power companies account for some 80% of India's industrial emissions of sulphur- and nitrous-oxides, Reuters said.

280.title: YouTube can do more to combat misinformation: CEO Wojcicki
280.article_body: YouTube CEO Susan Wojcicki on Tuesday said the video-streaming platform can further improve its work to combat misinformation. "There will always be incentives for people to be creating misinformation...The challenge will be to keep staying ahead of that," she stated. She added that in enforcing its policies, YouTube is missing only about 10 to 12 content-violating videos per 1,00,000 views.

281.title: Would've been nice, but $10 bn was too much: KM Birla on Holcim deal
281.article_body: Aditya Birla Group Chairperson Kumar Mangalam Birla on Wednesday said his company couldn't acquire Holcim's Indian business "primarily due to pricing issue". He stated, "It'd have been nice to have clinched the Holcim deal...[But] $10 billion was too high a price." Holcim's stake in Ambuja Cements and ACC was eventually taken over by Adani Group in a $10.5 billion deal.

282.title: Postmaster robs 24 families' fixed deposits for IPL betting in MP, loses ₹1 crore
282.article_body: A sub-postmaster in Madhya Pradesh, named Vishal Ahirwar, robbed 24 families' fixed deposits to bet in IPL and has lost ₹1 crore. His crime came to light when some depositors tried to withdraw their money but were told that their FDs were not in the record. He had issued genuine passbooks for fake fixed deposit accounts.

283.title: Take action against 'corrupt' ministers: K'taka AAP to state govt
283.article_body: The Aam Aadmi Party in Karnataka challenged the ruling BJP government to take action against 'corrupt' ministers. This comes a day after Punjab Health Minister Vijay Singla was dismissed on the charges of corruption. "We (AAP)...have filed several complaints over 40% commission charges sought by the BJP ministers," AAP state convener Prithvi Reddy said, demanding ouster of "tainted ministers".

284.title: All the best: Ashwani Kumar as Kapil Sibal quits Congress
284.article_body: Former Union Minister and former Congress leader Ashwani Kumar wished Kapil Sibal 'all the best' after he quit the Congress party. "Every person has the right to decide his strategy and political strategy according to his conscience," Ashwani Kumar said. "After the 'Chintan Shivir', there are many people who have said goodbye to the party," he added.

285.title: Happy birthday to the funniest guy I know: Preity Zinta to Karan Johar
285.article_body: Actress Preity Zinta, taking to Instagram, shared a picture with filmmaker Karan Johar and wished him on his 50th birthday. "Happy 50th birthday to the funniest guy I know," she wrote. "Karan, you're not only the king of bling but also the king of emotion and wit," she added. Karan directed Preity in 'Kabhi Alvida Naa Kehna'.

286.title: No urgency in hearing plea challenging Talaq-e-Hasan practice: SC
286.article_body: The Supreme Court said there is no urgency in hearing the plea challenging Talaq-e-Hasan practice and asked the petitioner to bring it up next week. As per Talaq-e-Hasan, a Muslim man can divorce his wife by pronouncing "talaq" once a month for three months. A plea has been moved in the Supreme Court seeking to declare Talaq-e-Hasan as unconstitutional.

287.title: CM Baghel unveils memorial of Jhiram valley Naxal attack victims
287.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel inaugurated 'Jhiram Ghati Shaheed Smarak' in Jagdalpur, built in the memory of Congress leaders and others killed in a Naxal attack in Bastar's Jhiram valley in 2013. He also unfurled the tricolour on a 100-foot-high flag post. Baghel accused the BJP of trying to hamper the state government's efforts to unearth the conspiracy behind the attack.

288.title: Karti Chidambaram summoned by CBI in bribe-for-visa case
288.article_body: Congress MP Karti Chidambaram has been summoned by the CBI for questioning in connection with the bribe-for-visa case. Punjab-based Talwandi Sabo Power Ltd allegedly paid Chidambaram and his close aide S Bhaskararaman ₹50 lakh for re-issuance of project visas for 263 Chinese workers in 2011. The Enforcement Directorate also filed case against Chidambaram on Wednesday.

289.title: Sikkim temporarily bans pigs' sale due to African Swine Fever cases
289.article_body: The Sikkim government has temporarily banned the sale of pigs as African Swine Fever cases have been reported in the North Sikkim district, an official said. As many as 117 pigs have died in the state in the last two months. The Animal Husbandry Department has asked people to refrain from eating pork.

290.title: 35-year-old TV artiste Amreen Bhat shot dead by terrorists in Kashmir
290.article_body: Terrorists fired upon a 35-year-old woman named Amreen Bhat at her residence in Budgam, Jammu & Kashmir today. She was shifted to hospital in injured condition where doctors declared her dead. Her 10-year-old nephew who was also at home received bullet injury on his arm. Three terrorists of terror outfit LeT were involved in the incident, said police.

291.title: Kanye was difficult to live with, I'm really into Pete: Caitlyn Jenner
291.article_body: Caitlyn Jenner, speaking about Kim Kardashian's relationship with ex-husband Kanye West, has said that the rapper was "very difficult" to live with. She added that she's "really into" Kim's current boyfriend Pete Davidson. "We have a comedian in the family. Yay! We don't need more rappers. We need a comedian in the family," she stated.

292.title: Hungarian govt extends emergency powers amid Ukraine invasion
292.article_body: The Hungarian government has passed a constitutional amendment giving itself emergency powers to deal with the "constant threat" posed by the ongoing Russia-Ukraine war, PM Viktor Orban has said. The amendment will permit PM Orban to enact laws by decree without parliamentary oversight. Orban stated that the powers would help the government protect Hungarians by "any means possible".

293.title: Punjab govt will present paperless budget, it'll save ₹21 lakh: CM
293.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann said that his government will present a paperless budget this time. Mann described the move as a step towards e-governance. "With this, around ₹21 lakh of the state exchequer will be saved [and] 34 tonne paper will be saved...it means it will save 814-834 trees," he tweeted.

294.title: Burkina Faso seizes 115 kg of cocaine worth $11.5 mn from vehicle
294.article_body: Customs officers in Burkina Faso seized a record haul of around 115 kilograms of cocaine last week, the Directorate General of Customs said on Wednesday. The seized drugs, estimated to be worth more than $11.5 million, were reportedly hidden in a vehicle. All smugglers on board escaped from the scene and no arrests have been made, a Customs spokesman said.

295.title: Man accuses wife of domestic violence, tearing his clothes in Raj; video surfaces
295.article_body: A 32-year-old man in Rajasthan's Bhiwadi has accused his wife of domestic violence, stating, "My wife tears off my clothes, thrashes me for no reason." He has also approached a court in Alwar to provide him adequate security. A video has also surfaced, showing the woman beating him up with a bat while he tries to defend himself.

296.title: 28-yr-old woman hires man to kill husband in Delhi, both arrested
296.article_body: Police said that a 28-year-woman was arrested along with the man she hired to kill her husband in Delhi. The accused Chander Kala gave Jumman, a history-sheeter, a hammer and ₹1.5 lakh to kill her husband and tried to make it look like a robbery attempt, the police said. The weapon and ₹50,000 have been recovered, they added.

297.title: Caste-based census will ensure social equality in India: Pawar
297.article_body: Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) supremo Sharad Pawar on Wednesday demanded that a caste-based census be conducted nationally, stating that it'll ensure social equality in India. Pawar added that Centre will be able to adequately provide concessions to the OBC community with the help of such a census. Notably, Bihar CM Nitish Kumar has convened all-party meet to discuss the issue.

298.title: I was drunk when I first met Big B, he hugged me: Manoj Bajpayee
298.article_body: Actor Manoj Bajpayee revealed that he was drunk when he first met Amitabh Bachchan while the veteran actor had come to attend the screening of Manoj's film. "I was shivering because Amitabh Bachchan was watching my film with his family," he added. Manoj said he asked Amitabh if he could hug him. "And he hugged me," Manoj stated.

299.title: 10-yr-old Bihar girl who lost a leg hops to school for 1 km, Sonu Sood offers help
299.article_body: A video of a 10-year-old girl named Seema hopping to school for one kilometre on one leg in Bihar's Jamui has gone viral. Her leg had to be amputated following an accident two years ago. Offering her help, Sonu Sood tweeted, "Time has come to walk on both feet." The DM also reached Seema's house and gave her a tricycle.

300.title: RCB's Rajat Patidar smashes fastest hundred of IPL 2022
300.article_body: RCB batter Rajat Patidar smashed the fastest hundred of IPL 2022 by reaching the three-figure mark off 49 deliveries against LSG in Eliminator at the Eden Gardens in Kolkata. The hundred is Patidar's first in T20 cricket. The previous fastest hundred in IPL 2022 was registered by LSG captain KL Rahul (56 deliveries).

301.title: Was freaking out after Leonardo DiCaprio praised me at Cannes: Urvashi
301.article_body: Actress Urvashi Rautela has said that she fell short of words and was "freaking out" after Hollywood actor Leonardo DiCaprio praised her at the Cannes Film Festival. "I was so emotional and could feel happy tears in my eyes. At the same time I was blushing too," she stated. "He also appreciated me as a very talented actress," Urvashi added.

302.title: Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia region to issue Russian passports: Official
302.article_body: Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia region has begun preparations to issue Russian passports to residents, an official has confirmed. This comes amid Kremlin's new decree mentioning that residents of Ukraine's Kherson and Zaporizhzhia regions will be able to acquire Russian passports through a simplified process. Kherson recently introduced Russian rouble as its official currency alongside Ukrainian hryvnia.

303.title: Russian Parliament removes upper age limit for army recruits
303.article_body: Russian Parliament has approved a bill to remove the upper age limit for contractual service in the military to strengthen the armed forces, a report said. Reportedly, only Russians aged 18-40 and foreigners aged 18-30 can enlist as professional soldiers in the Russian military at present. This comes as over 1,000 Russian service personnel had been killed since Ukraine's invasion.

304.title: Rowdy Rathore, Kabir Singh worked better in Hindi than original: Bhushan
304.article_body: T-Series head Bhushan Kumar, speaking about remakes of South Indian films, said, "'Rowdy Rathore'...'Kabir Singh' worked better in Hindi as compared to the original industry." "It's not that all films from South origin are working at pan-India level," he added. Bhushan stated that a film has to be good to work, be it a remake, original or a sequel.

305.title: Beyond our reach: B'luru court to man seeking ₹50 lakh over worms in Cadbury chocolate
305.article_body: A consumer court in Bengaluru has directed a man seeking ₹50 lakh as compensation after finding worms in ₹89 Cadbury chocolate bar to approach the state consumer forum. The court told the man, who filed the complaint in 2016, that the relief he was seeking was beyond its reach. He complained against Cadbury's Indian manufacturer Mondelez India Foods Private Limited.

306.title: Man thrashes wife to death for not cooking rice for him in Thane
306.article_body: A 23-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly thrashing his 20-year-old wife to death with a wooden stick for not cooking rice for him in Thane's Bhiwandi. The accused, Shankar Waghmare, a scrap dealer, had married the victim, Jyotsna, a year ago. The couple's neighbours tried to intervene but they found Jyotsna lying in a pool of blood.

307.title: Will talk directly to Putin, not via intermediaries: Ukraine's Prez
307.article_body: Amid the ongoing Ukraine-Russia war, Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Wednesday said that he's only willing to talk directly to Russian President Vladimir Putin and not via intermediaries. He further said that if Putin "understands reality", there's the possibility of finding a diplomatic way out of the conflict. Ukraine will fight until it recovers all of its territories, he added.

308.title: Depp never pushed me, kicked me or threw me down any stairs: Ex-girlfriend Kate Moss
308.article_body: British model Kate Moss dismissed reports that her ex-boyfriend Johnny Depp once threw her down a flight of stairs. "He never pushed me, kicked me or threw me down any stairs," said Moss, who was testifying at Depp's defamation trial against his ex-wife Amber Heard. Kate testified that she slipped on a staircase, after which Depp called for medical services.

309.title: Hypergrowth at any cost no longer rewarded: Sequoia to founders
309.article_body: VC firm Sequoia Capital, in an advisory to the founders of its portfolio companies, said, "Era of being rewarded for hypergrowth at any cost...is quickly coming to an end." It added that "money is no longer free" and investors are shifting towards companies that can demonstrate current profitability. It warned companies to not expect quick recovery from current market conditions.

310.title: India has no plans to lift ban on wheat exports for now: Govt
310.article_body: Union Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal has said that India has no immediate plans to lift a ban on wheat exports. "Currently there is instability in the world, if we were to do that (lift the ban), it would only help black marketeers, hoarders and speculators," Goyal told Reuters. India banned wheat export on May 14.

311.title: No need for lectures on human rights: China's Xi tells UN official
311.article_body: Chinese President Xi Jinping on Wednesday told UN human rights chief Michelle Bachelet that no country has a utopian scenario when it comes to human rights, further stating that "patronising lecturers" aren't needed. Xi also questioned the 'politicisation' of such issues. His remarks come during Bachelet's visit to China amid reports of alleged abuse against Uyghur Muslims in Xinjiang province.

312.title: British retailer Marks & Spencer to exit Russia after 17 years
312.article_body: British clothing-to-food retailer Marks and Spencer on Wednesday announced that it will fully exit the Russian market after 17 years. It stopped shipments to Russia in March but earlier stated that complex franchise deals prevented it from withdrawing completely. The company, which has 48 stores there, will face a $39 million hit from its exit, it said.

313.title: 5 NBFCs' registration cancelled due to irregular lending practices
313.article_body: RBI on Wednesday said it has cancelled the Certificate of Registration (CoR) of five non-banking financial companies (NBFCs) due to irregular lending practices. The CoRs were cancelled as the NBFCs violated RBI's Fair Practices Code. The NBFCs were also not complying with extant regulations pertaining to charging of excessive interest and had resorted to undue harassment of customers, RBI said.

314.title: How's 'Prasad' Mr Sibal: BJP's Jitin Prasada as Sibal quits Cong
314.article_body: After Kapil Sibal quit Congress and filed Rajya Sabha nomination with Samajwadi Party's support, his ex-party colleague Jitin Prasada asked, "How's the 'Prasad' Mr Sibal!" Prasada, who joined BJP after quitting Congress last year, was referring to Sibal's old tweet. "Jitin Prasada. Joins BJP. The question is will he get 'Prasada' from BJP...?" Sibal had tweeted.

315.title: 10-yr-old student was shot dead by Texas shooter as she tried to call 911
315.article_body: A 10-year-old schoolgirl, Amerie Jo Garza, was shot dead by 18-year-old suspected shooter Salvador Ramos in Texas school as she tried to call 911. Her grandmother said Amerie was calling the emergency services while sitting next to her best friend who was left "covered in her blood". The fourth-grader was one of the 21 victims of the mass shooting.

316.title: Mobile services suspended in Pak's parts amid Imran Khan's Azadi march
316.article_body: Pakistan government has ordered the suspension of mobile services in Punjab's 11 districts in view of ex-Pakistan PM Imran Khan's 'Azadi March' to Islamabad, a report said. This comes after clashes erupted between Khan's Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf and police during the march. Police fired tear gas at protesters who were rallying to demand the parliament's dissolution and subsequent general polls.

317.title: Clashes erupt during ex-Pak PM Imran Khan's Azadi march, many held
317.article_body: Several workers of ex-Pakistan PM Imran Khan's Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) were arrested on Wednesday after clashes erupted during Khan's 'Azadi March', which was headed towards Islamabad. Police fired tear gas at protesters who were rallying to demand the parliament's dissolution and subsequent general elections. Khan, who was ousted via a no-trust vote in April, had called for the march.

318.title: Tom Cruise has enormous skill & talent: Actress Jennifer Connelly
318.article_body: Actress Jennifer Connelly praised her 'Top Gun: Maverick' co-star Tom Cruise and said that the actor has "enormous" skill and talent. "He has more enthusiasm...passion and dedication to making movies than anyone I've ever come across," she added. 'Top Gun: Maverick' is the sequel to the 1986 film 'Top Gun'. The film also features Val Kilmer.

319.title: Amazon opens first physical fashion retail store in Los Angeles
319.article_body: Amazon on Wednesday announced that it has opened its first brick-and-mortar clothing retail store, called Amazon Style, in US' Los Angeles. As per Amazon, the store will use machine-learning technology to help customers find clothes and personalise recommendations. Customers shopping on the Amazon app will also have the option to try out their selections at the physical store, it added.

320.title: Maharashtra BJP leaders protest seeking OBC reservation in polls
320.article_body: Nearly 40 BJP workers, including senior party leaders, were detained by the Mumbai Police after they staged a protest against the MVA government, seeking reservation for the OBCs in elections. An official said that the detained BJP workers were taken to Mumbai's Azad Maidan and later released. "This government seeks revenge and behaves like [the] British," BJP's Sudhir Mungantiwar said.

321.title: 22-yr-old man killed for resisting robbery attempt in Gurugram
321.article_body: Officials said that the police have booked several unidentified persons for killing 22-year-old Ashish Singh for resisting a robbery attempt in IMT Manesar, Gurugram. The victim suffered grievous injuries to the back of his head, neck, eyes, face and hands, the police said. Singh's family alleged that he was robbed of his cellphone, a silver neck chain and other belongings.

322.title: What are the punishments & fines imposed on Yasin Malik by NIA court?
322.article_body: Kashmiri separatist leader Yasin Malik was sentenced to life imprisonment and fined ₹10 lakh for offence under Section 17 of UAPA. For offences under Section 121 of IPC, court awarded him life imprisonment and ₹10,000 fine. He also received jail term of 10 years and ₹10,000 fine each for violating Sections 120B, 121A of IPC, Sections 18, 20 of UAPA.

323.title: Clip of Karan Johar's acting debut from 1989 goes viral on his b'day
323.article_body: A video of a 15-year-old Karan Johar making his acting debut has gone viral on social media. The clip is from a 1989 TV show called 'Indradhanush' which also featured Urmila Matondkar. Twitter users shared the clip on the filmmaker's 50th birthday. Karan made his acting debut in Bollywood with Shah Rukh Khan's 'Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge' in 1995.

324.title: Ukraine's Prez offers condolences over Texas school shooting
324.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has offered his condolences to the families of the 21 people who were killed in a shooting at a school in US' Texas. "This is terrible to have victims of shooters in peaceful times," he said. The 18-year-old suspected attacker, who shot and killed the 21 people, including 19 students, was later shot dead by police.

325.title: 42-yr-old K'taka man clears Class 10 exam after 28 yrs along with son
325.article_body: A 42-year-old man, Rahmathulla, in Karnataka passed Class 10 exam with 333 marks after three failed attempts in the last 28 years. His son also cleared the exam and scored 98% marks. Rahmathulla said his son used to teach him after he returned home from work. "This was really one of the biggest moments of my life," he added.

326.title: Which are the top 10 companies in America as per Fortune 500 list?
326.article_body: Walmart has topped the 68th edition of the Fortune 500 ranking of America's largest companies, with $572 billion revenue. It is followed by Amazon and Apple, with $469 billion and $365 billion revenue respectively. The list also features CVS Health, UnitedHealth Group and Exxon Mobil. Berkshire Hathaway, Alphabet, McKesson and AmerisourceBergen are the other companies in the top 10.

327.title: Asaduddin Owaisi is destroying the country like Jinnah: BJP MP
327.article_body: BJP MP Harnath Singh Yadav said that AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi is doing the same work of destroying the country that Muhammad Ali Jinnah did before Independence. Accusing Owaisi of trying to mislead the Muslim community, he said, "If Owaisi does not stop the act of breaking the country, then he will have to spend time in the jail only."

328.title: 10 arrested as fake job racket busted in Noida, ₹6 lakh recovered
328.article_body: Police said that they busted a fake job racket in Noida and arrested 10 people for allegedly cheating people with fake job offers. The suspects cheated over 50 people to the tune of ₹20 crore in the last couple of years, the police said. They added that seven laptops, 17 mobile phones and ₹6.74 lakh cash were recovered from them.

329.title: LSG to bowl first against RCB in Eliminator, playing XIs announced
329.article_body: Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) captain KL Rahul won the toss and elected to bowl first against Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) in IPL 2022 Eliminator on Wednesday. LSG have made two changes to their playing XI, with Krunal Pandya and Dushmantha Chameera replacing Krishnappa Gowtham and Jason Holder, respectively. Mohammed Siraj has replaced Siddharth Kaul in RCB's playing XI.

330.title: India's Instagram users can now post 3D avatars in Stories, DMs
330.article_body: Instagram-parent Meta on Tuesday launched 3D virtual avatars to be used on Instagram Stories and direct messages (DMs) in India. Meta also released an update for its 3D avatars on Facebook and Messenger app in India, which allows users to create their own virtual selves. The updated avatars include cochlear implants and over-the-ear hearing aids.

331.title: Andhra signs deals worth $16 bn at WEF, to generate 38,000 jobs
331.article_body: Andhra Pradesh signed renewables investment pacts worth $16 billion (around ₹1.2 lakh crore) with  three companies, Adani Green Energy, Singapore's GIC sovereign wealth fund-backed Greenko and Aurobindo Realty & Infrastructure, during the WEF at Davos. The pacts involve setting up  hydro, solar and wind power related projects in the state. The investments will create 38,000 jobs, an official said.

332.title: 2 Naxals carrying ₹12 lakh reward surrender before Maha Police
332.article_body: Two Naxals carrying a collective reward of ₹12 lakh on their heads surrendered before the Gadchiroli police in Maharashtra, officials said. The Naxals were allegedly involved in various killings, arson and encounters, the officials said. In a press release, Gadchiroli Superintendent of Police Ankit Goyal said that from 2019 till date, 49 hardcore Naxalites have surrendered before him.

333.title: Man beats 22-yr-old wife to death after an argument in Thane
333.article_body: Police said that a man allegedly thrashed his 22-year-old wife to death with a wooden log after a domestic dispute in Maharashtra's Thane district. The incident took place on Tuesday evening and the 28-year-old accused, Shankar Waghmare, was arrested in the early hours of Wednesday, the police said. The accused has been booked under IPC Section 302 (murder), they added.

334.title: Denmark may give vaccines to close contacts of monkeypox cases: Report
334.article_body: Denmark is considering providing vaccines to close contacts of those who have been infected with monkeypox, Reuters reported quoting the Danish Health Authority. This comes after Denmark confirmed two monkeypox cases in individuals with travel history to Spain. As many as 20 countries, including the US, UK, Israel, Portugal and Switzerland have reported monkeypox cases.

335.title: I want death penalty for him: IAF martyr's wife as Yasin gets life term
335.article_body: The wife of Air Force officer Ravi Khanna, martyred in a terror attack allegedly carried out by Jammu and Kashmir separatist leader Yasin Malik, said she wasn't satisfied with life imprisonment awarded to him. "I want...death penalty for him in my case," said Nirmal Khanna. A Delhi court has sentenced Malik to life imprisonment in a 2017 terror funding case.

336.title: Yasin Malik's supporters clash with security personnel, pelt stones in Srinagar
336.article_body: Several supporters of Yasin Malik clashed with security personnel and pelted stones outside his residence in Srinagar on Wednesday. The security personnel fired tear gas during the protest, which was held ahead of Malik's sentencing. He has been sentenced to life imprisonment in terror funding case by an NIA court in Delhi.

337.title: World's shortest living teenager confirmed as 17-year-old from Nepal, pics released
337.article_body: Dor Bahadur Khapangi (Nepal) has officially been confirmed as the shortest teenager living (male). Khapangi, born on 14 November 2004, is now 17 years old. The measurement took place on 23 March 2022 in Kathmandu, Nepal. Khapangi was confirmed to be an average height of 73.43 cm (2 ft 4.9 in), revealed Guinness World Records.

338.title: Relatives had cut several of my outfits with scissors: Urfi Javed
338.article_body: Urfi Javed recalled an incident when her relatives "took their anger" out on her clothes. "With a pair of scissors, they cut so many of my dresses, saying some showed cleavage while others were sleeveless," she stated. Urfi added most of those relatives now want a selfie with her. "I've always been bold and loved to dress well," she said.

339.title: Filmwaala was filmwaala in our time; not Hindu, Muslim, Sikh: Tanuja
339.article_body: Veteran actress Tanuja, talking about the progress in the film industry, has said that the film industry has become corporate "instead of being a family". "When you become corporate then it becomes very compartmentalized," she added. Tanuja further said, "In our time, filmwaala was just filmwaala...Not a Hindu, Muslim, or Sikh, just filmwaala."

340.title: China conducts military operations near Taiwan
340.article_body: China on Wednesday announced that it had held military operations near Taiwan. This comes after US President Joe Biden said that the US would defend Taiwan militarily if China invaded the self-ruled island. In response to Biden's remarks, China said that it's a "purely internal affair", adding, "Taiwan is an inalienable part of China's territory."

341.title: Thieves write 'I love you' on TV after ₹20 lakh theft from Goa home
341.article_body: Thieves broke into a bungalow in Goa and ran away with valuables worth ₹20 lakh. The robbers left an 'I love you' note using a marker on the television screen of the house in Margao town. The house owner had gone out on a two-day holiday when the accused ran away with gold and silver ornaments and cash.

342.title: Lynching-accused are punished in Pak, garlanded in India: Mufti
342.article_body: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti on Wednesday compared the judiciaries of India and Pakistan in terms of treatment of lynching cases. "A man was lynched in Pakistan, they sentenced six people to death...Several [people] have been lynched [in India] after 2015...The accused [have been] garlanded, not punished," she said. "That's the difference between their judiciary and [ours]," Mufti added.

343.title: 2 Rafale fighter jets collide mid-air during airshow in France; video surfaces
343.article_body: A video has surfaced online, showing the moment two Rafale fighter jets collided mid-air during an airshow in France's Chateaubernard military base on Sunday. The top tail of one of the two jets got severed in the collision, but it managed to land safely. The part of the jet reportedly fell on a house and damaged its roof.

344.title: No petrol in any petrol station in Lahore, no cash in ATM: Ex-Pak cricketer Hafeez
344.article_body: Former Pakistan cricketer Mohammad Hafeez took to Twitter to give a glimpse of problems faced by the "common man" in Pakistan. "No petrol available in any petrol station in Lahore??? No cash available in ATM?? Why [does] a common man [have] to suffer from political decisions?" he wrote. He tagged former Pakistan PM Imran Khan and current PM Shehbaz Sharif.

345.title: We will fight back: Brother of dismissed Punjab Health Minister
345.article_body: After Punjab Health Minister Vijay Singla was dismissed by CM Bhagwant Mann and arrested for corruption, his elder brother said the family is taking the legal recourse to defend Singla. "There's a serious nefarious design to implicate Vijay...It's difficult to identify the perpetrators at the moment, but we'll fight back against the bid to tarnish my brother's image," he added.

346.title: J&K separatist leader Yasin Malik sentenced to life imprisonment in terror funding case
346.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir separatist leader Yasin Malik has been sentenced to life imprisonment in the 2017 terror funding case by a Delhi court on Wednesday. The NIA had sought death penalty for Malik, who was earlier convicted in the case by the court. Notably, Malik had pleaded guilty to all charges, including those under the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act.

347.title: My parents' split hasn't put me off idea of marriage: Shruti Haasan
