347.article_body: Speaking about her parents Kamal Haasan and Sarika's marriage, Shruti Haasan said, "When it worked, they were a brilliant couple...that's what I chose to look at." She added that she wouldn't "write off the idea of marriage" just because of her parents' divorce. "It was a fantastic marriage and that's what I chose to take away from it," she stated.

348.title: TMC has culture of bringing Rohingyas: BJP leader Saumitra Khan
348.article_body: BJP leader Saumitra Khan on Wednesday accused the Trinamool Congress (TMC) of propagating "a culture of bringing Rohingyas" to sustain itself in the government in West Bengal. Khan had earlier sought a ban on TMC, alleging that the party is responsible for the influx of Rohingya refugees in India. He had also termed the TMC a "terror supply party".

349.title: 46 held for violence after houses of minister, MLA set afire in AP
349.article_body: Police have arrested 46 people in connection with the violence which broke out in Andhra Pradesh's Amalapuram town over the renaming of the newly created Konaseema district as BR Ambedkar Konaseema district. The houses of a state minister and an MLA were set on fire during Tuesday's violence. Meanwhile, police have tightened the security and deployed additional forces in Amalapuram.

350.title: India likely to get 'normal' monsoon rains this year: IMD
350.article_body: India is likely to get normal seasonal monsoon rainfall this year, said Jayanta Sarkar, Head, India Meteorological Department (IMD) Mumbai. Heatwave conditions are unlikely to prevail over the country and light to moderate rainfall is expected in Konkan and Goa region during the next five days, IMD said on Wednesday. Isolated heavy rainfall likely over some northeastern states, it added.

351.title: India-Pakistan not moving forward, but 1 day we'll engage economically: Pak Min
351.article_body: Pakistan Minister Bilawal Bhutto Zardari on Wednesday said that his country's relations with India have not been moving forward. "But one day we'll get to the position where international institutions will...ensure the international order. Definitely, there will be a day when we'll be able to engage with our neighbour to the east, not just diplomatically but also economically," he stated.

352.title: Shutdown in parts of Srinagar ahead of court verdict on Yasin Malik
352.article_body: Some areas in Jammu and Kashmir's Srinagar observed a shutdown on Wednesday as a court was scheduled to give a verdict on the quantum of sentence for separatist leader Yasin Malik, who has been convicted in a terror funding case. Some shops in Maisuma and Lal Chowk were closed. Security forces were deployed in strength to maintain law and order.

353.title: Coinbase becomes first crypto company to get listed on Fortune 500
353.article_body: Coinbase, the San Francisco-based crypto exchange, has become the first cryptocurrency company to break into the Fortune 500 list. Currently ranked at 437, Coinbase has a market value of $41,670 million and over 3,700 employees, as per Fortune. The exchange was singled out by Fortune editor-in-chief Alyson Shontell as one of "several pandemic winners".

354.title: Biden's approval rating falls to 36%, lowest of his presidency: Poll
354.article_body: As Americans suffered from rising inflation, US President Joe Biden's public approval rating fell to 36%, the lowest since he took office in January 2021, a Reuters/Ipsos opinion poll found. Around 59% of Americans disapproved of Biden's job performance, according to the two-day national poll. Biden's approval rating has been below 50% since August last year.

355.title: He likely moved from last call spot: Official on Delhi man's death in Pune
355.article_body: While talking about Delhi engineer who was found dead after he went missing in a forest in Pune, an official from group specialising in search and rescue, said the man seemingly moved away from location from where he made last call to his friend. The official also advised trekkers to stay at location of last call if they get lost.

356.title: Pune BJP MP supports locals protesting over civic garden's name
356.article_body: Pune BJP MP Girish Bapat on Wednesday extended support to Salisbury Park residents who have been protesting over the renaming of the civic garden. Former BJP corporator Shrinath Bhimale had in March put up a board naming the garden after his father, late Yashwantrao Bhimale. Residents of Salisbury Park have been protesting against it for the last two months.

357.title: Accused not linked to LeT: Lawyer of Pune man held in terror case
357.article_body: The lawyer of a Pune youth arrested on Tuesday by Maharashtra's Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS) after being accused of having links to Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) stated that the youth, Mohammad Junaid, isn't linked to the terror outfit. The 28-year-old suspect has been "brainwashed" and "falsely implicated", the lawyer further said. Junaid has been sent to ATS' custody till June 3.

358.title: Hyderabad hospitals refunded ₹1.61 cr to 87 COVID patients: RTI reply
358.article_body: After complaints of overcharging COVID-19 patients, private hospitals in Hyderabad have refunded over ₹1.61 crore to 87 people between November 2020 and June 2021, as per a reply given to an RTI application. The Director of Public Health and Family Welfare had earlier issued guidelines on hospital tariffs. It had put a limit on various charges.

359.title: Cryptocurrency platform CoinTracker announces India foray
359.article_body: Cryptocurrency platform CoinTracker has announced its foray into the Indian market. Starting Wednesday, its crypto tax compliance and portfolio tracking products will be available to all crypto users in India. The dropping trading volumes and uncertain crypto regulations in India won't affect the firm as it's not dependent on users to have to transact a lot, said CEO Jon Lerner.

360.title: Prostitution racket busted at Bengaluru spa; 3 women rescued
360.article_body: Bengaluru City Police have busted a prostitution racket that was allegedly being operated from a spa centre, the city's Joint Commissioner of Police (Crime), Raman Gupta, said on Tuesday. Acting on a tip-off, police reportedly raided the spa centre, Zen Glow Salon Spa and Wellness, and busted the racket. Furthermore, police rescued three women from there and arrested one person.

361.title: We should give equal importance to each language of India: Ayushmann
361.article_body: Ayushmann Khurrana, speaking over the national language debate, has said, "We really can't keep one language at the forefront." He added India has multiple languages, multiple religions, regions, communities and ethnicities. "We should give equal importance to each language of our nation," he added. This comes after Ajay Devgn-Kiccha Sudeep's Twitter debate on Hindi being the national language.

362.title: Delhi HC rules out discrimination case by disabled person against Uber
362.article_body: Delhi High Court asked a complainant to delete Uber India from the list of parties named in his discrimination against persons with disability petition. As per Uber, the court said notice needed to be issued to the Centre alone as it'll implement the required directives. The petitioner had alleged an Uber driver refused to keep his wheelchair in his taxi.

363.title: 75 missing, 1 confirmed dead after migrant boat sinks off Tunisia
363.article_body: As many as 75 people went missing after a boat carrying migrants sank off Tunisia on Wednesday, according to the International Organization for Migration. It added that 24 people were rescued from the boat which had departed from Libya. The body of one person was found while the search was on for the others, said a Tunisian security official.

364.title: Narinder Batra resigns as Indian Olympic Association president
364.article_body: Narinder Batra has resigned from the post of Indian Olympic Association (IOA) president. Batra said he took the decision to focus on his role as President of International Hockey Federation (FIH) as "world hockey is going through an essential development phase". "I wish my successor and the whole sports family in India every success in the future!" he added.

365.title: Paramilitary officer hugs Adivi after watching 'Major', video surfaces
365.article_body: In a video that has surfaced online, a paramilitary officer can be seen talking to and hugging actor Adivi Sesh after watching his movie 'Major', that is based on life of Major Sandeep Unnikrishnan. The officer, who was in a wheelchair, can be seen showing Adivi how he got goosebumps after watching the film.

366.title: To the man who's my father & best friend: Alia on Karan Johar's 50th b'day
366.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt wished Karan Johar on his 50th birthday. Taking to Instagram, she shared unseen photos with Karan from her wedding. Alongside the post, Alia wrote, "To the most generous soul I know...to the man who is my father...my best friend...and my mentor...Happy 50th birthday K! I pray and wish for only love, peace and joy in your life."

367.title: Steps taken to prevent waterlogging at critical spots in Delhi: PWD
367.article_body: Delhi's Public Works Department (PWD) has taken multiple steps to prevent waterlogging during monsoon at critical locations. At least seven critical spots which are prone to waterlogging have been identified out of 145 such locations, senior PWD officials said. The steps include construction of drains and sumps, installation of automated pumps and deployment of additional maintenance vans.

368.title: Will accept hanging if Intel proves my role in terror activities: Yasin Malik
368.article_body: As the National Investigation Agency has urged the court to give death penalty to Jammu and Kashmir separatist leader Yasin Malik, he said he'll accept the hanging if Indian Intelligence proved that he had been involved in any terrorist activity or violence in 28 years. "Then, I will also retire from politics," he said.

369.title: My fees was slashed in half as I played mute character, felt disrespected: Manoj
369.article_body: Actor Manoj Bajpayee recalled that he felt disrespected after his fee was slashed in half by a show's producer. Manoj said that filmmaker Anubhav Sinha cast him as a mute man for his show 'Shikast'. He added that when he went to collect his fees after four months, the producer said, "Payment is for dialogues, where are your dialogues?"

370.title: Lift sanctions & we'll allow ships with food to leave Ukraine: Russia
370.article_body: Russian Deputy Foreign Minister Andrey Rudenko said Russia is ready to provide a humanitarian corridor for vessels carrying food to leave Ukraine if some sanctions imposed on Moscow are lifted, Interfax reported. Ukraine's Black Sea ports have been blocked since Russia began invading Ukraine. The European Union has accused Russia of using food supplies as a weapon with global repercussions.

371.title: Check untreated waste being released in Ganga: NGT to U'khand govt
371.article_body: The National Green Tribunal (NGT) directed the Uttarakhand chief secretary to check discharge of untreated waste into Ganga. The direction came following a petition that claimed agents of municipal corporation in Rishikesh bathed and washed vehicles using the tap installed outside a toilet complex on the banks of river Ganga. NGT further ordered the chief secretary to take remedial action.

372.title: US Open champion Raducanu knocked out of French Open in 2nd round by world no. 47
372.article_body: US Open 2021 champion Emma Raducanu has been knocked out of the French Open 2022 in the second round. The 19-year-old lost the match 6-3, 1-6, 1-6 to world number 47 Aliaksandra Sasnovich of Belarus. Sasnovich has reached the third round of the Roland Garros for the first time in her career.

373.title: Wanted to respect the game even if we lose: Hardik on GT's win vs RR
373.article_body: Discussing GT's win by seven wickets against RR in IPL 2022's Qualifier 1, GT captain Hardik Pandya said, "We goofed up against MI and wanted to respect the game...even if we lose." "[I] wanted...[me, David Miller] to finish," added Hardik. Talking about his performances with the bat, Hardik stated he hasn't been successful batting at the position of his choice.

374.title: Captain Abhilasha becomes 1st woman officer to join Army Aviation Corps as Combat Aviator
374.article_body: Captain Abhilasha Barak has created history by becoming the first woman officer to join the Army Aviation Corps as Combat Aviator. "Captain Abhilasha Barak has been awarded the Coveted Wings along with 36 Army Pilots by Director General & Colonel Commandant Army Aviation," the Additional Directorate General of Public Information, IHQ of MoD (Army) tweeted on Wednesday.

375.title: Ate dumplings, that's it: Raducanu on celebrations after US Open 2021 win
375.article_body: Talking about the celebrations after she won the US Open in 2021, Great Britain's tennis player Emma Raducanu said, "There was nothing big or amazing that my parents did to celebrate." "We just came home and ate dumplings, and that was it. We are very normal," added Raducanu. Raducanu became the first-ever qualifier to win a Grand Slam title.

376.title: Chandigarh immigration firm owner cheats 15 people of ₹2.29 cr, booked
376.article_body: The owner of a Chandigarh-based immigration firm was booked for allegedly cheating at least 15 people of ₹2.29 crore on the pretext of sending their children abroad on student visas. The accused man took possession of their passports and original documents. Besides the main accused, seven other staff members from the office are under the scanner, police said.

377.title: Violence in TN town after burnt body of fisherwoman found near shrimp farm
377.article_body: The partially burnt body of a 47-year-old fisherwoman was found in an isolated area near a shrimp farm near Vadakadu fishing town in Tamil Nadu on Tuesday. Alleging the deceased was gang-raped and burnt, locals set the farm afire and attacked workers whom they suspected were behind the crime. They've been protesting near taluka office, seeking justice after the incident.

378.title: Satish Kaushik accuses Go First of using 'dubious ways to earn money', says got no refund
378.article_body: Satish Kaushik accused Go First airline of using "dubious ways" to earn money. Kaushik said his office booked two seats "in first row with middle seat" and paid ₹25,000. He alleged the flight sold middle seat to another passenger despite his office paying for it. Kaushik added his office has been contacting customer care and their reply was 'no refund'.

379.title: Pay more attention: Ethereum Co-founder on recent crypto crash
379.article_body: People must pay more attention to what is belying the currency name when they get involved, said Ethereum's Co-founder Gavin Wood with regard to the recent crypto crash which wiped $800 billion off their value. The crypto crash led to Terra's LUNA crypto token crashing nearly 100%. "The internet has no real concept of legality," Wood added.

380.title: People come & go from Congress: Venugopal on Kapil Sibal's exit
380.article_body: Reacting to ex-Union Minister Kapil Sibal's exit from Congress, party leader KC Venugopal said "people come and go" from Congress. "[Sibal] had already written a letter to...party president...[it said] that he firmly believed in...Congress' values," he stated. Sibal, who was affiliated with Congress for over 30 years, filed nomination for Rajya Sabha polls with Samajwadi Party's support today.

381.title: 6 civilians killed in Ukraine by Russian shelling: Governor
381.article_body: At least six civilians were killed by Russian shelling in Severodonetsk city in eastern Ukraine, Governor of the Luhansk region, Serhiy Haidai, said on Wednesday. Haidai added that another eight people were injured in the last 24 hours in the city. He claimed that the Russian forces were deliberately attacking the shelters where civilians were hiding.

382.title: IPL betting racket busted in B'luru; 1 held, over ₹2 lakh seized
382.article_body: Bengaluru City Police have busted an IPL betting racket, the city's Joint Commissioner of Police (Crime), Raman Gupta, said on Wednesday. Police have also arrested a man for his alleged involvement in illegal betting on a cricket match between SunRisers Hyderabad and Punjab Kings. Police have seized over ₹2,00,000 in cash, a mobile phone and other items from his possession.

383.title: Punjab govt hikes milk procurement prices by ₹55 per kg fat
383.article_body: The Punjab government announced an increase in milk procurement prices by ₹55 per kg fat for dairy farmers. The increase in milk procurement prices will not have any impact on retail milk prices, said Punjab minister Harpal Singh Cheema. This decision comes after dairy farmers held a massive protest at a state-owned milk plant in Mohali, seeking hike in price.

384.title: You'll always be in my heart: Sanjay on dad Sunil Dutt's death anniversary
384.article_body: Marking the death anniversary of his father, Sunil Dutt, actor Sanjay Dutt on Wednesday shared a post for him on his social media. Sharing a throwback picture of them, Sanjay wrote, "Through thick and thin, you were always there to guide and protect me. You were my strength...in every need...You will always be in my heart Dad, I miss you."

385.title: Assam man carries illegal weapons to SP office; arrested
385.article_body: Assam Police arrested a man from the Nagaon district on Wednesday for allegedly carrying illegal weapons to the office of Superintendent of Police (SP) Leena Doley. They also recovered a pistol, six bullets along with two mobile handsets from his possession. "Arrested man already has cases of extortion and dacoity filed against him," the SP said.

386.title: Many uniting for 2024: Sibal on filing RS nomination with SP’s support
386.article_body: After resigning from Congress and filing Rajya Sabha nomination with SP's support, Kapil Sibal on Wednesday said many people are coming together for 2024 when the Lok Sabha polls are scheduled to be held. "We, many people, are coming together for 2024. We will expose the shortcomings of the central government ahead of 2024," Sibal added.

387.title: Future plans are to unite Opposition to oppose BJP: Kapil Sibal
387.article_body: Soon after resigning from Congress, Kapil Sibal said that his future plans are to unite the Opposition to oppose the BJP. Sibal added that the BJP is following "anti-people policies" and is "dividing" the inclusive culture of India. "We (the Opposition) want to create an alliance so that we can oppose the (PM) Modi-led government," Sibal said after his resignation.

388.title: 9-ft-long alligator missing top half of its snout spotted in US; pic surfaces
388.article_body: A nine-foot-long alligator with missing top half of its snout was spotted in a lake in the US' Florida. "I saw this gator far away and he looked weird to me...The whole end of his top jaw is missing...By the looks of him, he's doing alright though," the woman who first spotted it said in a post.

389.title: Not everything is misleading like your birthdate: Mishra to Afridi for defending Yasin
389.article_body: Reacting to ex-Pakistan cricketer Shahid Afridi calling terror charges against Jammu and Kashmir separatist leader Yasin Malik "fabricated", cricketer Amit Mishra tweeted, "Dear Afridi...he himself has pleaded guilty in court on record." He added, "Not everything is misleading like your birthdate." Yasin was convicted in 2017 terror funding case by an NIA court in Delhi after he pleaded guilty.

390.title: Country Delight raises $108 million at $615 million valuation
390.article_body: D2C fresh foods brand Country Delight has raised $108 million in series D funding led by Venturi Partners and Temasek, at a valuation of $615 million. Others who participated in the round include, SWC Global and Trifecta Capital, IIFL Asset Management, Elevation Capital, Orios Venture Partners and Matrix Partners. The round takes the company's total funding to $147 million.

391.title: Delhi Transport Minister inaugurates 3 automated driving test tracks
391.article_body: Delhi government has started three automated driving tracks for people to take the test for obtaining their driving licence. Delhi Transport Minister Kailash Gahlot on Wednesday inaugurated the three tracks in Mayur Vihar, Shakur Basti and Vishwas Nagar. The tracks have been opened for people who are unable to spare time during the day, an official said.

392.title: Russian lawmakers pass bill to close 'unfriendly' foreign news outlets
392.article_body: Russian lower house of Parliament passed a bill giving prosecutors powers to shut foreign media outlets in Moscow if a nation has been "unfriendly" to Russian media. This follows the closure of some Russian state news outlets in the West. The bill needs to be reviewed by upper house of Parliament and signed by President Vladimir Putin to become law.

393.title: Had to handle kids during Mr India, now they say 'you were so strict': Satish
393.article_body: Actor Satish Kaushik said that he had the task of handling all the children who were part of 'Mr India'. "I had to train the children for the performances, I nearly took a whip to them to collect them. Now they say, 'Satish uncle, you were so strict.' I used to shout at them during the shooting also," he added.

394.title: Producers didn't want to work with me, it changed post 'The Kashmir...': Darshan
394.article_body: Actor Darshan Kumaar, who was recently seen in 'The Kashmir Files', spoke about how things changed after the film's success at the box office. He said, "Directors were always keen on working with me but the producers weren't ready to commit." "Earlier...the same people who didn't want to invest in my...projects are now casting me as...lead in films," he added.

395.title: Sandalwood smuggler Veerappan's elder brother dies at hospital in Salem
395.article_body: Madhaiyan, the elder brother of sandalwood smuggler Veerappan, died of a cardiac arrest at a hospital in Salem on Wednesday morning, police said. Madhaiyan was admitted to the hospital on May 1 following complaints of severe chest pain. He had been sentenced to a life term in connection with the murder of a forest ranger in 1987.

396.title: Centre trying to impose Gujarat-model everywhere: Mehbooba Mufti
396.article_body: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti criticised the central government by saying that the Centre is trying to indulge in "communal politics" and impose Gujarat-model everywhere as it has nothing to offer to youths. "If Centre has strategies like Hitler against the Muslims then it should have the courage to reveal what they want to do with them at once," Mufti added.

397.title: Waited for 6-7 hours, he was busy: Ayushmann on why he couldn't meet SRK
397.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana opened up about what would've been his first-ever meeting with actor Shah Rukh Khan. He said, "I remember our first meeting. I was doing radio and I had to interview him. I couldn't interview him because he was shooting for...ad film." "I waited for 6-7 hours...he was busy. I had to...go back to the studio," he added.

398.title: Ashwin keeps proving people wrong, has been a revolution for RR: Jaffer
398.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer said all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin has been a revolution for RR in IPL 2022, adding that he keeps on proving people wrong. "Whatever the role you put him in, you find him acing that well," stated Jaffer. Ashwin currently has a strike rate of 146.82 in IPL 2022. He has picked 11 wickets so far.

399.title: Delhi civic body releases 1 month's salary, pension of all employees
399.article_body: Municipal Corporation of Delhi has released one month's salary and pension of all employees and pensioners, officials said on Tuesday. "The corporation has made a fund of ₹432.84 crore available for this purpose," a senior MCD official said. The teachers of municipal schools had not been paid salaries for the past six months, AAP had alleged.

400.title: 21-yr-old man beaten to death by girlfriend’s family in Madhya Pradesh
400.article_body: A 21-year-old man was allegedly beaten to death by his girlfriend's family members after they caught the duo in an objectionable state in a field, a police official in Madhya Pradesh's Indore said on Tuesday. The body of the deceased, identified as Vinod Chouhan, was found in the Khudail area. "The girl's parents and brother are missing," police said.
